Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, good vibe and cute Max”
Reviews.Author: AlexMove
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Rex for 5 days and had great time. The hotel is in a great location just off Union Square, close to a Walgreens (24hrs) for those pesky little midnight needs and a Starbucks if one insists on drinking that nasty coffee. The hotel is full of character, with a literature theme. Small reception, small bar/restaurant area serving breakfast in the morning and meals later in the day. They also have a free glass of wine or 2 in the evening hours. All very civilised. We were in the larger style King bed room, flat screen TV, amenities in bathroom, hairdryer, amble wardrobe space, lighting pretty good and air/heating was quick when turned on. Room had no issues - all good. Free wi-fi throughout hotel which was pretty fast and easy to use. Gitanjali (on reception) was lovely and responded quickly to my few requests. Lorenz (General Manager) was quick with responding to emails, was friendly and very accommodating. We will not hesitate to stay at Hotel Rex next we visit San Fran. PS Max is the dog that has his own Throne in the reception area...so cute and wrinkly!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent venue”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: When in San Francisco, you can stay at any of the large chain hotels - and feel like you're in any city - or stay at the Hotel Rex and feel like you're in San Francisco. I have stayed at the Rex my last two visits, and both were marvelous experiences. This is a lovely intimate hotel with a courteous staff that knows you after the first day. Located near Union Square, it is conveniently situated for access to all sections of the city. Without exception, I have found the staff to be pleasant, friendly, and professional. The rates are reasonable for such an immaculate hotel, which has prompted me to stay a day longer than planned. They no longer have a restaurant, but food is served in the artsy Library Bar, and there is plenty of excellent eating nearby. In short, I find the Hotel Rex to be the right size, in the right location, with attractive prices, and an excellent staff. In my five visits to San Francisco I have stayed at smaller hotels, and this is my favorite on every level. A highly recommended destination.

Reviews.Title: “Pricy parking, good room, swell location”
Reviews.Author: Ebonius
Reviews.Content: I used a "last minute" booking service and got a base-rate $160-something single room for about $99 plus taxes and the City of San Francisco's annoying little "bites" that wind up on the bill. Totaling about $129 all inc. If you are driving, be prepared for a parking hit of at least $34 every 24-hours. Seriously! You have no choice but to get your car off the street and into a parking garage around the corner after you off-load your bags. The hotel valet will do the job for you for $40 a day, but that means every time he brings your car around, be prepared to tip him a few more bucks. I chose to just drive around the corner myself. It's easy. The rooms do not have air conditioning, but they come with a pedestal fan and it's enough to take the musty-hotel smell out of the air in minutes. The bed was firm and sheets were awesomely smooth fine cotton. NEWS: As I was leaving, at least 10 new mattresses were arriving by truck. So they are keeping up with new beds. The bathroom was squeaky clean! But typical of San Francisco and many other California cities, they have water restrictors on the showers. When are people going to realize that it takes a certain amount of water to get the soap and shampoo off your body. Whether it gets washed off fast under a normal volume stream of water, or whether you have to stand under the shower head for four minutes with the water running -- all they are doing is wasting your time because the same amount of water is used. Breakfast buffet was the usual affair, but the food was well cooked and fresh. I'd definitely stay at this hotel again, but I would either take a taxi or the BART to get there. The parking fee was simply too much.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and arty but may not be for those with kids”
Reviews.Author: luvvacurry
Reviews.Content: Overall OK. Small hotel with muted colours, subdued lighting, dark furniture, lots of art throughout. 1920s style. Not mainstream. Good points: *Well located hotel. Ten minute walk to Union Square and about two minute walk to cable car stop. *Free glass of wine every day *Friendly and helpful staff *Small, friendly and cosy bar area within the library: I saw quite a few single, mature guests who were able to meet, drink and chat in non-intimidating surroundings. It was very welcoming and laid back *Weekly movie night in the library area - big screen and projector *Couple of bone-shaker bikes provided *Free wi-fi *If you like art and books, you'll probably love this place Downsides: *Room and bathroom were very small. Double beds were small too. Our 9 year old slept in one whilst we were cramped in the other. *Some of the wiring and cabling left quite a bit to be desired - tacked to carpet and what seemed to be a number of overloaded plugs were jutting out underneath the desk *one slow, small, cramped elevator *kids seem a little out of place here as the target audience doesn't seem to be families, although our child stayed free *not much choice for dining - breakfast buffet only and no kids menu Probably a great place to stay if you're into art and the like or the drawing room culture.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in any sense”
Reviews.Author: SEBASTIAN C
Reviews.Content: It was our honeymoon trip in SFO. The choice was perfect. The manager gave us an upgrade and a pleasant surprise. All the staff was very corteous. The location is very good, just blocks away of Union Square. We will gladly return

Reviews.Title: “Good trip....”
Reviews.Author: kathleen o
Reviews.Content: Thank you to Jay and Dennis who helped make our trip complete..lots of great info on what we were looking for..neighborhoods and cool places to dine..big hug to housekeeping for looking after us...cheers..Don Guthro. Kathleen OConnor

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: pensoso
Reviews.Content: Friday night in the Library Bar, sipping a favorite liberation and listening to the chanteuse sing in French......what more can one ask? This is why the Hotel Rex is the only place to stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: prettybullet
Reviews.Content: The position of this hotel could not be better, being within five minutes walk of Union Square. The staff were welcoming and helpful, just what you need after an eleven hour flight from the UK. Our room was at the front of the hotel, and this is the only reason we have not given an excellent rating. We were there for three nights from Friday - Sunday and the noise from the street outside was very loud. Late night revellers, and then early morning bin men!! Having said that, that is my only complaint, and we enjoyed our stay there very much. My advice - if you have the choice, pick a room at the rear of the hotel. The library bar/lounge area is lovely and a great place for an early evening glass of wine (free) and a bar snack or meal if you don't feel like venturing out again. We didn't breakfast at the hotel, preferring to go out and get an authentic "American Diner" experience! However overall I would highly recommend the Rex for it's friendly staff, location, cosy rooms and the lovely bar area, so much nicer than the large, soulless hotels which all look the same. If you are coming to San Francisco, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, a deal for the $”
Reviews.Author: ThomasJandMe
Reviews.Content: Ths hotel is exactly what we were looking for...a boutique hotel in downtown San Francisco. Rooms are cozy, clean and the bed is very comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. The bar atmosphere with the library setting is fun. We will definitely be back. Thanks for an awesome three nights at the Rex.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: happy-travel22
Reviews.Content: The Rex is in a perfect position for seeing San Francisco,s highlights on a short break.The hotels quirky literary theme throughout makes it feel very personal.The staff were all very pleasant and the reception staff very helpful with information and restaurant recommendations.After a long site-seeing day the complimentary glass of wine in the convivial atmosphere of the library bar was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday trip with daughter.”
Reviews.Author: a1emslie
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay in a central location, preferably in a unique type of hotel.The location was perfect and all the staff encountered were more than helpful.I loved the atmosphere in the bar, in particular.The wine in the evenings was a welcome change after cookies in New York.Minor room problems were easily resolved.Would I stay there again?Undoubtably.We felt extremely safe and the location was perfect.What would I change?I would give the hotel a coat of paint and do a general update.More blankets are needed in the bedrooms and perhaps more lighting.This is not a hotel that would appeal to everybody.If you are used to standard 5* luxury and want just that, then don't stay here.But if you are looking for something a bit different with a welcoming atmosphere, excellent food and the occasional live jazz, even if the decor is a bit sad, then enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the San Francisco experience”
Reviews.Author: wiscad
Reviews.Content: The Rex Hotel is exactly what you would expect a building in San Francisco to be like. The building is old, the elevator is tiny and it is in the heart of the all the action a tourist could want. If you want to stay in a modern building this is not the hotel for you. The elevator is tiny. The stairwell is crammed and the steps and floors are uneven. But that's all part of the charm. Our room faced Sutter Street and there was considerable noise every night. Everything from the traffic to rowdy crowds to the garbage trucks and street cleaners. Fortunately I'm a fairly heavy sleeper so it didn't bother me at all. The room was perfectly serviceable with a modern TV and a typical minibar. One of our favourite features of the hotel was the 5 o'clock wine tasting in the lounge. It was great to start eacj evening with a couple pre-dinner cocktails and sample some of the local vintages. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. They made some great recommendations for dinners and handled all our reservation needs. The valet parking is quick and not too pricey. Valet parking costs slightly more than some of the close by lots but you can come and go as many times as you like throughout the day so if you're in and out it a few times a day you'll probably end up paying less. The only problem is that the service isn't available between midnight and 6am which meant we had to get creative on the last day to make sure the car was available at 5am so we could make our flight. Union Square is tourist central. Almost obnoxiously so. If you're there to shop and sight-see you'll love it. We wandered and found restaurants nearby a couple times and went a little further a couple times for something specific. Only once did we need to take a cab though as there are so many options so close by and we enjoyed taking in the neighborhood walking a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, really friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Wildy29
Reviews.Content: Pro's • Centrally located but still quiet • Nice decor Con's • Shower and bath weren't great • Bed a little too hard for my liking

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: kayandjohn_12
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful boutique hotel with great staff and service. And a great "neighborhood" bar to have your complimentary glass of wine each evening. The location is excellent--just two blocks from Union Square with many restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time !!”
Reviews.Author: hokulealinda
Reviews.Content: I live in San Francisco but didn't want to be bothered ... with anything. I'm old. I needed a place close to Disposable Film Events ...They did a fabulous job with valet-ing my car. Very reasonably priced. I had room 705 top floor. Elevator. Warm. Spotlessly clean. Wi-fi worked beautifully. Large flat-screen tv. Wonderful service from the doorman, to counter staff, to assistance finding the film events, to help the next morning in the rain at the crack of dawn to get me out to sound engineering class. Yep! You heard it ! :-) Let's Joie de vivre

Reviews.Title: “Perfect haven on rainy SF weekend”
Reviews.Author: finneywatt
Reviews.Content: Lovely. We stayed in a King Executive. As another reviewer stated, it was ideal in every way. I do wish there were a way to have a coffee maker in the room (perhaps a couple kept downstairs to be doled out for the coffee hound guests only). Max is the best fixture in the sweet lobby. The Friday night jazz is great and all in all just perfect for us. We're looking forward to returning when we have more time to explore all that SF has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Thankful for an uncleaned room...”
Reviews.Author: deniseds
Reviews.Content: If you can afford it, get the King Executive. We were booked in a Queen Deluxe on the 7th floor which was dark, cramped, dingy and felt its age. Fortunately it wasn't cleaned, nor was it clean 5 hours later when we returned, so we were graciously moved to a lovely King Executive on the 3rd floor: 2 windows, lovely view to the garden, spacious. I get that old hotels have character and history instead of level floors and big rooms, but it's the lack of value here I object to. I shopped a lot of hotels and paid extra, but was sorely disappointed with our original room. With the upgrade? Perfect. Otherwise, nice staff, good coffee, great location...maybe with the "book" theme they could have a shelf of borrowable books / old paperbacks down in the lobby...just a thought.....

Reviews.Title: “A great historic literary hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bevee1287
Reviews.Content: very conveniently located near Union Square. Room was clean,comfortable and furnished in appropriate vintage decor. Only thing missing was an in rooom coffee set up. Excellent food at the wedding we attended...and also the buffet breakfast. Great helpful and friendly staff. A great place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: millport-1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is central and close to shops, transport etc., staff very friendly and helpful, would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Tumbleina
Reviews.Content: Great location! Very clean. Friendly staff. Free Wi-Fi. Complimentary glass of wine each evening. Will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mollchar
Reviews.Content: Hotel has an excellent location, around the corner from Union Square, Rooms are very basic but comfortable. they have a bicycle in the lobby for guests to avail of if you can manage the hills, staff very pleasant and helpful. complimentary glass of wine in the afternoon is a nice touch

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, friendly, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: zrdc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real jewel! The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful, taking extra time to suggest entertainment and transportation options. The room was attractive, clean, and well-appointed. Bed was fine, not too soft. We ate one dinner in the Library Bar to test the food, and it was quite acceptable, especially for the very reasonable prices. Three tips: my Android phone wouldn't connect to their free wi-fi, and Verizon service is poor at this spot. If you need a cab, walk 1 1/2 blocks to the St. Francis Hotel and get in the cab station line. Very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique, but in an "anti-W" way.”
Reviews.Author: psos
Reviews.Content: A few things stood out during my March stay at the hotel. First and foremost the weekend desk staff were fantastic. Orion and Gitanjali had the slightly bad luck to be stuck working what was a beautiful weekend in SF. The overwhelming impression I got from them was - lets find a way for you to enjoy this most. That included great recommendations of places to spend the sunny afternoons and to watch said sun hide in the ocean in the evening. (And also plenty of recommendations of places to get into good food and mischief after the sun went down). The location is central and seemed safe, but slightly less unique than other more eclectic parts of the city. The hotel however more than made up for this in its charm. I really felt like I was their target demographic (30's, single, interested in a bargain food truck burrito, Michelin star ratings, a proper cocktail, or a relaxed pint with equal enthusiasm). The rooms have a (and I mean this in no way derogatory light) a lived in or almost slightly shabby comfort. More of the old familiar sweater than the latest trendy frock. It is not an inexpensive hotel, but priced competitively especially given its location. If I had a complaint - I'd take some more water pressure in the shower, but I am really stretching here if that is the best I can come up with. TA's high ranking of this hotel was totally accurate in this case - and often I find I do not always agree with the masses. The service is usually great - but this hotel's style and atmosphere were exactly what I wanted for a weekend in one of the world's great cities.

Reviews.Title: “So Impressed”
Reviews.Author: jracleveland
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at Hotel Rex while in San Francisco for four days. I can't begin to describe how pleased we were with the experience. The value of the hotel can't be compared, especially because of it's fantastic location - right off of Union Square. Every staff person is friendly and accomodating, and they go out of their way to help you. The rooms were small but felt larger than some of the other hotels I've stayed at in the area. They're clean and comfortable and just what you need when you spend most of the day out exploring the city. I will definitely return in the future. Thank you Hotel Rex for a memorable trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Another good Joie de Vivre experience”
Reviews.Author: Rick A
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in a suite. The suite was on the 7th (top) floor and in the back of the hotel, so away from street noise. The room had a bed and flat screen 2 in 1 room, and a sofabed and another flat screen in the second room, and we actually had a full bathroom and a half bath. Each room had adequate sitting/reading areas; the main bedroom had a very nice chaise lounge. Excellent location for Union Square and Nob Hill, with the Financial District and Ferry Building easy walks. The room was great, as was the free coffee and newspapers in the lobby each morning and free glass of wine in the afternoon. Stylish place, maybe not ideal for kids younger than about 15. The only physical issue was the single small elevator.

Reviews.Title: “The "good", "bad", and "ugly"!”
Reviews.Author: ccinchico
Reviews.Content: I will start by stating we love this chain and Hotel Rex was certainly no exception! But...we may have stumbled into a bad weekend for not only Hotel Rex but San Francisco as well! The Oakland Bridge was closed down into the City for reconstruction, so the entire city was a bit off. THE GOOD: A perfect location near Union Square in a clean, fairly trendy area. Personelle that loves to take care of you and remembers yours and your dog's name. Pet friendly and with that said rooms are very clean and you would never know they allowed pets! Nicely decorated and good amenities such as an honors bar in the refrigerator that is nicely stocked AND you can use it for your own items without fearing charge like some hotels! Windows that open! Nice comfortable little bar with great wine free of charge in the evenings. Quick and efficient room service. Pet is free and they even provide a bowl of water and food dish. Large TV and lots of channels and even a IPod dock. THE BAD: We were in room 601 and there was a very loud clunking noise (sounded like the ceiling was falling in) constantly. Don't know if it was the toilet above us or what? It would wake us up from a sound sleep! Although the bed was very comfy, the pillows were overstuffed and we both woke up with a bit of a sore neck! THE UGLY: Where the Bridge caused a problem for the city...a broken pipe and fire alarm caused problems for the hotel. The trek to and from the 6th floor with a dog the first night of stay was no fun! That said, this was no ones fault and the staff tried very hard to compensate for the problems and it was very appreciated! They sent up wine so we didn't have to hike back and forth, didn't charge me for taking a Corona beer from the honors bar since the bar was closed due to the flood and gave us a coupon for a drink the following evening. All in all a wonderful stay and we look forward to going back...as does our dog Fenway!

Reviews.Title: “Almost 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: mstimc
Reviews.Content: We are regular visitors to San Francisco, so we know what we're getting into when we make a reservation. A lot of older hotels call themselves "boutique" when what it really means is old, musty, with a few second hand antiques to give them character. Hotel Rex is the real deal. The staff is top flight and very knowledgeable. Our room (sixth floor in the back) was quiet and neat as a pin. Some other reviews have commented on the room size. I've been in hotels with very large rooms that waste the space or provide cookie cutter decor. Our room at the Rex was of a good size, but even better, laid out in such a way as to make the best use of the space. My wife and I both had our own night tables and reading lamps, and the writing desk had lots of drawers. The decor is fun without being cutesy. The bathroom, while on the small size, as very clean and well-supplied. It was the kind of room you can enjoy being in because of its furnishings and layout. My only suggestion would be another shelf or two in the bathroom because of the limited counter space. And you can't beat the location--depending on your willingness to walk uphill (its always uphill in SF)! you're minutes from Union Square shopping, Chinatown, and Nob Hill. The only reason I didn't give it five stars...about 10:30 on Friday night the fire alarm went off. Nothing seemed amiss so I called the front desk--no answer. So we got dressed and trudged down six flights of stairs, join our other roommates on the sidewalk while the fire trucks rolled up. The alarm malfunctioned and the staff seemed to be a little befuddled on how to fix it. After a while, we walked back up the six flights because the single small elevator was way too backed up. And the next afternoon, it happened again! This time I called and they told me it was a malfunction, but for th next half hour we endured the alarm going on and off intermittently. After a long day walking, all we wanted was a little rest, but all we got was the fire alarm! Maybe the staff could use some extra training in the area. All in all, an enjoyable stay, and we'd go back again.

Reviews.Title: “exellent”
Reviews.Author: mariasandra62
Reviews.Content: great location, comfortable rooms, great breakfast close to everything

Reviews.Title: “A short stay that'll stay with me for a long time”
Reviews.Author: Mitch A
Reviews.Content: We stayed in San Francisco for 3 days to see the sights and made a last minute booking with Hotel Rex because of it's low price and surprisingly high ratings. We weren't disappointed and neither will you be if you stay here. The hotel itself is small, not boutique small but it's definitely not high volume. The rooms are very neat, well presented with an interesting literature based theme. The hotel is also quite green focused (as is the way in San Francisco), however I was pleased that the 'green' options were that, optional and I did not feel pressured by any means. Hotel Rex provides you with the usual amenities such as cable & a mini bar and we were encouraged by staff to use the mini bar for what ever we needed and to just remove any mini bar items we needed to. What set them apart for me was one particular night of my stay. I had to make arrangements for my girlfriend and my 7 year anniversary dinner. Both the bellman and the concierge helped me greatly going through a number of options for me as well as providing me a reservation at a fantastic nearby restaurant, Palominos. With a great seat along with a wonderful walk along the pier I owe all the boyfriend points I earned to the staff at Hotel Rex. As we arrived home after a fantasic dinner and walk we were greeted with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries! I have never reviewed any other hotels I've stayed at before but I felt obligated to spread the word about this wonderful hotel. Stay and you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Central, pretty and convenient”
Reviews.Author: PDounias
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco in November 2011 and we chose Rex mainly due to the reviews on tripadvisor and its central location. The hotel is right in a not so loud part of the center on the foot of Nob Hill, minutes from Union Square and next to the cable lines. So public transport is not needed for visiting most of the sites with the only exception being the Mission, Haight Ashbury, Castro, Alamo Square and Golden Gate Park. With regards to the hotel itself, rooms are very nice and pretty, and quite spacious for a SF central hotel, even though a bit small by american standards. Staff is excellent, always helpful and very knowledgeable. The public spaces are quite intimate and small enough to feel at home. On the down side, prices do remind you the fees you would pay in London or Barcelona for an equivalent hotel and also the crowds may be considered a bit pretencious by some. But all in all a very good stay and a great match for a dreamland city like SF.

Reviews.Title: “Old ... but still good!”
Reviews.Author: finder45
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights there. Great, central location within easy walking distance to excellent shopping, Chinatown, the piers, etc. They really take advantage of the age of the hotel with a cozy "library" feel in the reception and dining/lounge areas. People of all ages and pairings quietly enjoyed the cloistered early evening wine offering. My room was small, but very well appointed and comfortable. Others have commented on the total commitment of the staff to meeting the needs of all guests with a true sense of sincereity. That I found to be true from check-in to a 4:00am checkout. I look forward to returning there with my wife.

Reviews.Title: “A true reflection of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: natmic
Reviews.Content: This is a different hotel to most chain styles. It has its own unique and quirky style but certainly doesn't lack sophistication. The rooms are generous and welcoming. The staff are the drawcard for all the Joie de Vivre Hotels and the Hotel Rex staff are no exception. They greeted us warmly and gave us touring suggestions that were appropriate for a family with two boys aged 11 and 13yrs. Their suggestions were not typical but certainly gave us a better insight into lifeand history of San Francisco. Its location is central and the nearby shopping is fantastic. This was my first time to San Fran and we sadly only had three nights here. We would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, and decor”
Reviews.Author: BLFootInMouth
Reviews.Content: A really comfortable place to base your weekend in SF. A bit artsy and oozes character - subtly. The rooms at the back are really quiet day or night. But you're still two short blocks from Union Square. Reasonably small hotel; the staff are courteous and helpful. We had dinner Friday night in the hotel bar - The Library. There was live jazz on Friday night and we discovered that about 2/3 the people in the bar were locals - who are quite friendly. Even the singer came and said hi to us after she'd finished. Powell St streetcar is half a block from the hotel, though we walked to the Pier 1 area in about 15 minutes (great farmers' market on Saturday morning). The hotel is about 5 minutes' walk from the Powell St BART station. For a cheapskate like me, that's a great airport connection. Plus, taking BART rather than a taxi saves 10lb of carbon emissions per journey. Plus it saves $20, plus it saves 30 minutes during rush hour, ... Food options abound. Lots of Thai restaurants around the corner

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, "era " based hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rita T
Reviews.Content: Booked through Jetsetter so value was great. Had a suite. Very spacious and comfortable. Almost like going back in time. Great location for Union Square. Only reason for less than perfect is because of some loud clanging noise through out the night.

Reviews.Title: “Love love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: salamasana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December for a wedding and it was my favorite place I've stayed in San Francisco in probably 10 years. The building (and the hotel) is older; as can be heard by the neighbors flushing their toilets or turning on their sinks. There is so much charm at this hotel from the rooms to the elevator, the lobby and the staff. The hotel staff were so amazing, helpful, and so friendly. The location is great! Highly recommend this place to anyone staying in San Francisco. You can stay at a larger hotel or a bigger more well-known chain, but you will miss out on the charm of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Lia S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times at the Rex this year, and it has become my hotel of choice in San Francisco. It is a wonderful boutique well-located in the heart of San Francisco. The interiors are lovely, tastefully designed in the theme of literary San Francisco. There chic but comfortable chairs in the Library Bar/lobby with wonderful coffee table books for perusal, as well volumes for bedtime reading. On the landing of each floor is a quote by a celebrated local authors. The elevator has very cleverly been papered in pages from the Social Register. The Library Bar is a great place to have a drink, lunch, dinner, or an ample buffet breakfast! Terrific food, nice wines by the glass. The rooms are chic, impeccably clean, have nice linens, toiletries, etc. Rooms, halls, common areas are all well-maintained and look brand new. All of the staff are friendly and helpful. Unlike a lot of hotels, they seem to stay as well. So you're always greeted by a familiar face. Including Max the pug, the hotel mascot (and occasional valet). I look forward to my next trip to SF!

Reviews.Title: “When Location Is Not Enough”
Reviews.Author: SantaFeB
Reviews.Content: The Rex is well located in San Francisco, a couple of blocks from Union Square and near plenty of shopping and restaurants. But the delightful front desk staff notwithstanding, its location is the best part of the Rex experience. Free wine at the end of the day and a long list of amenities including free wi-fi do not diminish the monastic, claustrophobic experience of the dark hallways and the tiny rooms, rooms without views or sunlight to announce the dawn. For me a hotel can make or break a vacation or a business trip; the Rex broke mine. Having had an outstanding experience at the Vitale, another San Francisco Joie de Vivre property, I expected a similar visit to the Rex. Unfortunately, the two hotels are night and day, with the Vitale being the day, and the Rex the night...even during the day. If you care little about your room's size and cheerfulness, if you are simply looking for a place to drop your bags and fall asleep at night, the Rex might work for you. But if you are looking for a hotel in which to relax, to which you look forward to returning at the end of a busy day, look beyond the Rex.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, comfortable and charming”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: Close to Union Sq, this has an old world feel about it. One small elevator, adequate but not generously sized rooms, and the feel of an old (but nicely renovated) building, channeling a literary vibe. Just as long as you don't expect a fancy (soulless) modern hotel, you will love the very friendly and helpful staff, the social happy hour in the lounge, and Max the pug.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Will F
Reviews.Content: Good stay, great value but small rooms and please update the showers! You won't go wrong here great location too!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: LuluPDX
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a few SFO hotels and I would recommend the Hotel Rex. The colors are bright and cheerful, the room was clean, and the staff was helpful. It is very convenient to the financial district and a lot of excellent restaurants within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, affordable pricing”
Reviews.Author: Dallas_IAC
Reviews.Content: The location was great, and the rates were very affordable. My husband and I stayed here on two nights in two different rooms bookending our trip to Napa in November. On our first night, the room was fairly small and had quite a bit of noise from the street. We always use our white noise app on the iphone when we travel, and that was sufficient for drowning out the noise. On our second night, the room was much larger and quieter. The bathrooms in both rooms showed some wear and the towels showed some staining, but everything was clean. The beds were comfortable, and the staff was very friendly. I would definitely stay in this hotel again based on the price and location, but don't expect anything overly fancy. I would compare this to a European hotel with a tiny elevator, small rooms, and no frills.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay, but there aren't better options around”
Reviews.Author: VinnyGerard
Reviews.Content: Given the price of the hotels in San Francisco, Rex Hotel is a reasonable option for under $200. The main reason for choosing this hotel was its location, one block away from Union Square. Also, the staff was friendly enough. The rooms are recently renovated, but the hotel is a bit outdated. Slow elevator and old carpet. I would give this a lower rating because you normally get more in other places for what you pay here, but I didn't really find much better options in San Francisco. The free wi-fi was very good.

Reviews.Title: “fun staff great location great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarabug_11
Reviews.Content: this is a fantastic hotel in the heart of san francisco ca. close to union square,within walking distance of the great downtown of san francisco. the staff is terrific...super helpful and very friendly. the restaurant immediately off the hotel lobby is a great place to grab breakfast and the staff is also great....all I can say is ENJOY

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Stay”
Reviews.Author: AKTravelerFAI
Reviews.Content: San Francisco is an expensive city, and I booked the Hotel Rex for a stay in late June because of its good TripAdvisor reviews and because I found an attractive rate. I was fairly happy with my stay. I had called the day before my arrival about an early check-in and was warned that it would be unlikely, but my room was ready when I arrived. The staff was very friendly and professional, and the location convenient. The property has considerable charm, and while my room (especially the upholstered items) showed some wear, it was very quiet and the bed was very comfortable. I especially appreciated the complimentary WiFi, an amenity for which many other hotels in the area charge. Breakfast was not included, however, and I declined as it was overpriced compared to local restaurants' offerings. I didn't use the free drink coupons, which are only useful for guests if they are in the area in the early evening, which I wasn't. Including a breakfast rather than drinks would make the room a much better value. I'd not hesitate to stay here again if the price is right, though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Great location”
Reviews.Author: ayrshiregirl71
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Rex for 6 nights with our 5 year old. We booked a deluxe double double room. Will agree with other reviewers. The room was small ( It is a boutique hotel). We did struggle to juggle our 3 suitcases with floor space. Not ideal when you are staying for 6 nights. We did have air conditioning. The standard of housekeeping was excellent. We loved the library bar and the daily free glass of wine . Great location 2 blocks up from Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable boutique hotel in the heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: Amy S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Rex for our honeymoon and recently returned to celebrate our 10th anniversary! This adorable boutique hotel was even more lovely and inviting than I remembered it. The location is so convenient, and we looked forward to returning to the Library Bar every night for our complimentary glass of wine. The staff is extremely friendly, and they can offer lots of good recommendations for dining, sightseeing, etc. I cannot imagine going to San Francisco and staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Alice-Mick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2011. We loved it. All the staff were really friendly and helpful. We don't get the small room bit - they should stay in some hotels in Europe to see small! We liked the fact that it had real character especially the bar which is done up as a library We too enjoyed the free glass of wine every evening - a nice touch. It is in a great place - very central and near the cable car station and a BART station. If we go back to San Francisco we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelForFunAndWork
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for six nights in october 2011. It is true that the rooms are rather small by american standards, but given that the location is excellent and the prices not totally out of this world, this should be expected for a central San Francisco Hotel. The hotel is located near Union Square and the cable car stops at the next intersection. The rooms are very clean and nicely decorated. The beds are extremely comfortable. There is free WiFi available. Staff is very friendly and efficient. There is a small business room as well. Linen, Towels, Bathrobes and toiletries are of high quality. There are even slippers and Q Tips available. I've stayed in this hotel multiple times and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, personal, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: miffymoo
Reviews.Content: After close to 20 hours on a plane I opened the door to my room at Hotel Rex with a sigh of relief. This hotel feels much more like a guest room decorated by a caring friend than part of a large chain of hotels. The bed was comfortable and everything very clean and tidy. It was a short walk to Union Square, but just outside of the touristy area, which made it perfect for us. The free glass of wine each evening was a nice touch and we very much felt welcomed by the hotel, allowing us early check in after our very long flight. My only real advice would be to book early, as the prices seem to rise quite steeply as the date of stay approaches (we considered extending our stay but it was just too expensive). Next time I will definitely be booking early. This does not seem to be the hotel where you are best holding out for a last minute deal! The other thing I would probably say (as another guest brought it up with me) is the lift is very small and slow. If you have any lift phobias this is probably not the place for you. If and when I return to San Francisco this would definitely be my first choice for a hotel - save time searching around further because Hotel Rex ticks just so many boxes!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Blackpool_boy66
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely old building that has tons of character. There was a short wait at reception and then we were checked in very efficiently. The room was clean and always tidied efficiently. The bed was comfortable and we slept really well. There was a nice large glass of wine served free every night at the bar area. They even have a pair of bikes you can use (which we did) for free. All in all we loved the vibe of the place. But the best bit was the staff - they would do anything they could do to help out with recommendations for restaurants or trips. They were the best hotel staff I have ever come across and I have stayed in hotels for at least 20 nights a year for the past 20 years. You guys are a credit to the Rex and helped made our stay extra special. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great feel, great home base”
Reviews.Author: world-explorer89
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in Jan 2011 and it was great... Overall I really liked the room, and the whole atmosphere was quite charming, and the evening free wine and live music was great and alot of fun too. The location was excellent also, so close to Union Square, the tram, and lots of nice places to eat, it was really a great spot to stay. My only qualm was the heating in our original room didnt work and the room was bloody freezing! The next room wasnt that much better, and it was only a reverse cycle air conditioner (so veryyyy drying!) Also both my boyfriend and I found the corridors very creepy - I would be interested to know if anybody else got this feeling? It literally made my hair stand on end and very anxious for no logical reason! But all in all I would recommend this to any of my friends looking for affordable accommodation that is close and convenient

Reviews.Title: “Well-located and artsy hotel”
Reviews.Author: toronto4
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rex is located only a few blocks from Union Square. There are interesting shops and cafes in the immediate vicinity. Our room was comfortable, clean and had interesting touches. It was relaxing to sip the complimentary wine in the bar prior to going out to dinner. On our next trip to San Francisco, we would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Rooms, Great Bikes”
Reviews.Author: Janell V
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Rex for nights in September 2011. I added a guest to my room and hotel staff upgraded me to two queen beds at the same rate. They were very friendly and helpful with printing some documents that I needed for a conference and they also provided extra towels very quickly. My two favorite things were how sound proof the rooms were- we were up late and slept in late and did not hear any outside noise! and my second favorite was the two Globe bikes - although they were checked out when I made an inquiry I hope to use them on my next trip to the city. The only reason I gave it four out of five is that the wine bar was a little dull, and felt more like a lobby than a get away bar. (But there is an AMAZING bar right next door) Great Location! Clean and unique!

Reviews.Title: “Definately stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Julie2903
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fantastic trip to SF. Hotel Rex is full of character with clean, comfortable rooms although if you like your deco bright and airy this is probably not for you as the theme of the hotel makes it quite dark in the lobby and bar. Breakfast is basic and a little expensive. Due to 2 early starts and being tied to time we did try it for convenience. Some of our party only wanted cereal and at a bill which eventually worked out at $20 each this was an expensive bowl of cereal. Would highly recommend Lori's Diner just a couple of doors down for breakfast as they have lots of choice, the food is good and you only pay for what you have had. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful and the location in Union square was great for shops and transport to all the sights. The free drink in the evening (5pm-6pm) was a nice idea and we were even offered it after this time when we were late back(about 8pm) as we had missed it. Would also recommend Fino's Italian restaurant on Post which is about a 5 minute walk from hotel although best to book and Swiss Louis's restaurant at Pier 39. All in all a pleasant mid priced hotel in great location. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff in a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ernest B
Reviews.Content: Just to confirm all that the previous reviewers have said which is. Great location, really nice hotel albeit the decor makes it a bit quirky. The room was small but big enough and very importantly, clean. The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows. We were in room 416 which fronts onto the main street and is right beside the elevator. I am a light sleeper and was concerned that this would be too noisy for me. I slept well and was never disturbed by either the elevator or street noise. The staff in particular were very good, friendly and attentive. I want to give special mention to Gitanjali. She went way and beyond the call of duty in getting me directions to Joe's Cable Car, a burger joint I wanted to visit, even to the point of giving me her BART card. Thank you Gitanjali. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Make it a point to go to Mel's Diner on 4th and Mission for a great american diner experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: KMoor
Reviews.Content: We are native San Franciscans who find ourselves living in Silicon Valley due to our jobs. We miss The City and often make the hour-long drive to spend a weekend. We stayed at Hotel Rex in July when we had tickets to see Billy Elliot. We brought our two teenage daughters along. Our room and bathroom were very spacious and clean. We had a view of the back parking area and the backs of other buildings, but we could have cared less. Service at check-in was efficient and the staff was pleasant. We enjoyed our free glass of wine in the evening in the bar area. We slept soundly - very quiet rooms. The next day we enjoyed walking around Union Square. We caught the Muni bus back to the CalTrain terminal for our train back to Mountain View. I recommend Hotel Rex and think you'll be quite pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sueg47
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rex was our first stop on a 3-week trip to Northern California.The location could not be better... just off Union Square but remarkably quiet. Convenient for many forms of transport and easy walking distance to Chinatown, Ferry Building. Some people have remarked that the rooms are small, but our was spacious enough with 2 double beds, plenty of storage space and a more-than-adequate bathroom. Free in-room Wi-Fi worked well and the nightly complimenary wine was very welcome. Without exception, the staff were charming and helpful. Had breakfast on 2 mornings. The food itself was fine, but some of the staff could be a bit more on-the-ball on topping items up. Compimentary tea and coffe available if you want to make an early start or have breakfast elsewhere.This was a perfect base for 4 nights and we would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “All about the location.”
Reviews.Author: Missie99
Reviews.Content: The primary positive about this hotel is its location - a block from Union Square and within easy reach on foot of plenty of shops and restaurants. It's also a half block from the cable car, as well as close to other forms of public transport. I also felt safe in the neighborhood. The rooms are quite small and the decor is a bit dated, but everything is clean and comfortable. We'd definitely consider it again if returning to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great service”
Reviews.Author: Fred007_11
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay again at Hotel Rex on my return to San Francisco. Great location, very helpful, happy staff, clean & travelling by myself it feels very safe. I had again a large room, which was great for a 6 night stay, & very clean & quiet. I booked early & received a great price. The happy hour is a great feature. Will stay at Hotel Rex again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal boutique hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: caropete
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Rex for 6 nights at the beginning of a 3-week trip and found it very comfortable and the staff very welcoming and helpful. It was in an ideal location for everything that we wanted to do, within easy walking distance to Union Square and close to the cable car stop for Fisherman's Wharf. We had opted for a deluxe Queen room, which was quite small but very adequate, with ample storage space. We liked the overall decor of the hotel and its theme, especially the bar area, where we could enjoy the complimentary evening glass of wine, served by a bartender who obviously took pride in his area of the hotel. We had booked early and, whilst we didn't secure a rate as favourable as the previous reviewer, felt that this hotel offered very good value for money. We were pleased that we had chosen Hotel Rex as the first hotel of our trip and we would certainly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and Run Down”
Reviews.Author: WorldCitizenNewYork
Reviews.Content: The people are nice, but the hotel needs a major renovation. The carpet in my room had permanent stains, the elevator floor made weird sounds, the hallways look a bit tattered. There are lots of other boutique hotels in SF in better shape. Also - no fitness center and you need to pay $15 to go to one that is local but not very high-end.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in a prime SF location”
Reviews.Author: baseballbuff
Reviews.Content: I'm not normally a fan of boutique hotels because you never really know what you're going to get. However, Hotel Rex restored my faith in these types of hotels. For one thing, it is fairly quiet. Unlike a lot of boutique hotels, the walls aren't paper thin, so it's possible to get a good night's sleep without being woken up by your neighbors or outside noise. It has a nice decor, sort of a throwback to the 30's and 40's, but tasteful. The hotel bar has a library motif to it that gives you the urge to have a scotch, even if that's not you're thing. The employees are friendly and helpful and there's some good amenities like free WiFi, free newspapers (both local and the NY Times), and free wine during happy hour. It's also in a good spot. You're within walking distance to Union Square and all the shopping in that area. You're also within walking distance to Chinatown and the trolleys (and other public transportation).

Reviews.Title: “Quality of Rooms varies. Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: citygirlnyc034
Reviews.Content: If I were writing this review based on the first room I was given this would be a very poor review. I arrived late one night and although I had called the hotel that day and told them I would be arriving close to midnight the front desk clerk told me he had almost cancelled my room because I was so late. I was given a room on the 2nd floor with a window facing an airshaft. The room was dark and dingy and I didn't get any cell phone reception in the room. I called the front desk and asked if I could be moved and the clerk told me the hotel was full but maybe tomorrow. I went down at 7 a.m. the next morning because I did not want to spend one more night in that room (which wasn't any lighter during daylight hours) and a new front desk clerk was very helpful and let me look at two different rooms, one of which was on the 6th floor and had far more room and light (and actually had phone reception). It was like being in a different hotel. Clearly those rooms had been available the night before but for whatever reason the front desk clerk on duty that night wasn't as customer satisfaction driven. If my entire experience had been from that moment on, I would give the hotel 4 stars. The room was quite comfortable and large. The hotel has obviously been refurbished but the room was charming and everyone, original front desk clerk excepted, was very helpful and friendly. I'd recommend staying here but make sure to request a room on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel Near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: isdscuba
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean rooms and bathrooms, great decor! Receptionist was extremely friendly and helpful. Free glass of wine when you check in. Free, but slow wifi. Room service sandwich for dinner was poor, so avoided breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel close to Union Square, Nob Hill and Cinatown”
Reviews.Author: chapmanadam
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd visit to the Rex (from the UK). Hopefully that provides good endorsement. The best factor is it's location - a 2 min walk from Union Sq. Its second best feature is the complimentary glass of wine you get each day (Merlot was excellent). The service is great, we asked to move rooms, which was easily done. The rooms are air-conned, clean and a decent size. The bed was comfy enough. Free wifi throughout the hotel is a bonus. Would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Dog Gets It (My Vote, That Is)”
Reviews.Author: LaDolceVita27
Reviews.Content: Many reviews on TA seem a little pre-occupied with Rex, the hotel's pug, offering stridently pro- or anti-attitudes. For my money he typifies the hotel's style which is individual, relaxed and cosmopolitan. It should be obvious to anyone who has checked out the hotel's own web site that you should not expect state of the art in such an old building but even so they do pretty well. There is free Wi-Fi, a large flat screen TV, I-Pod dock and a good bathroom with Eco-friendly toiletries. There are some negatives, inevitably. Its central location means that after early evening you are likely to return to your hotel past some rather dubious characters. (San Francisco seems to have more rough sleepers than any other US city we've visited). In the distance at night, if you open your window, there is quite a bit of noise but no more than in most city centres. The single lift struggles to hold more than a couple with luggage and the plumbing may well keep you awake. That said, all of this is offset by individual touches like a glass of wine each afternoon, a friendly desk clerk who waives small telephone charges and, of course, a delightful old pug named Max.

Reviews.Title: “Character hotel in great location with free wine!”
Reviews.Author: JimBobOxford
Reviews.Content: There is nothing corporate about this hotel - every area has a quirky character, from the library bar to the corridors and rooms. It works. It's also in a great location, close to the shops of Union Square and the cable cars to Fishermans Wharf. On top of that, there's free wifi in the rooms and a free glass of wine every night. We booked early and got a great rate, but I would recommend this hotel to friends even if they had to pay a bit more. I'd also recommend a trip to the Ferry Building where you can buy delicious food and drink, including wines, cheeses, bread and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “dingy as the unwashed puppy who lives in the lobby”
Reviews.Author: Claire F
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel Rex to be a little on the dingy side, nothing was really clean ... from our rugs... to the bathroom (love finding other people's hair in the shower. Love it.) to the public areas. It's the worst to feel unclean in your own hotel room. But they really tried to make up for it in a lot of ways. Free stuff -- like free WiFi & wine happy hour every day, one of these days they even had a kids string ensemble performing. And we got a great price for the area, since they worked with our friends who were getting married to book a package for them. The concierge was friendly but less than helpful, since he didn't explain we'd need close to a 45min lead time to get a cab to dinner. (How would we know this? We told him hours in advance and he mentioned nothing.) So, I'd stay there again at that price, but if I had to pay "retail" I'd look for somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: Nessie067
Reviews.Content: A great small hotel with such friendly and helpful staff. We enjoyed it so much more than a large impersonal hotel. The location was great - near Union Square, shopping and Cable Car stops. As a result we were amazed at how quiet our suite was - we had taken earplugs just in case. We were awake early due to jet lag and the complimentary coffee and newspaper were ideal to start the day until we were ready to meet the world. We had no problems during our stay but all the contact we had with staff was friendly and efficient. Our kids particularly loved Max who is the receptionist Jeffrey's Pug. He definitely adds a real homely touch and even has his own face book page. Due to its size, the hotel does not offer a huge range of amenities but what they do offer they do well and touches such as a complimentary glass of wine in the evening were very welcome. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wine hour every day!”
Reviews.Author: OxfordBecky
Reviews.Content: A great location. Room lovely but small. Excellent service and a free large glass of wine between 5 and 6pm every day! Also a great diner on the corner of the block!

Reviews.Title: “Understated and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Edsmum984
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights. At first the decor and darkness are a little offputting, but the service is incredibly friendly without being smarmy. Our rooms were quiet and comfortable and the kids loved their twin room. Wifi is good. Whatever time you turn up in the bar (even if it's not during the wine hour), as a guest you're offered a free glass of house wine which we appreciated. We ate in the bar one evening as well and had great food - nothing fancy, but very well executed. The barstaff and front desk staff were all delightful. I would stay here again - it's central, comfortable and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good ambiance, but was hoping for more from the room amenities”
Reviews.Author: Gronzie
Reviews.Content: If you're into character and charm and wish to be located near Union Square, this is a good choice. The lobby and bar lounge feel of the re-modelled hotel are both quite good, and while the rooms are a bit small, the room on the seventh floor was quiet which was good. The room service food was also good. Where the hotel failed to impress was with the air conditioner being very old and loud, the room was unreasonably hot, and the bed was very uncomfortable. After a few nights there, i wish i would have chosen differently for a hotel stay, to get a better experience for the cost of the room. While the staff were friendly and amenable, Concierge assistance was not made available during the 5-night stay, and would have wanted to know about health club or gym access.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location to discover san francisco”
Reviews.Author: nojoha
Reviews.Content: we had almost a perfect stay in this hotel. beside of its great location (we've been quite happy that we've chosen city center vs fisherman's warf) the service was excellent. As there was only one room left the day we arrived we got an upgrade for the following 3 nights in the back side of the hotel. The room was perfectly quit but unfortunately the hotel not. The walls between the rooms seems to be very thin and also the doors. Furthermore the flushing of the toilets you can here from all rooms next to you as well as from the upper and lower levels. And believe, those flushes are really noisy. Beside of those small issues we really enjoyed our stay there and I once again need to point out the great service from the staff - and this is finally what make a stay nice or not!

Reviews.Title: “Fun boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sanderson_72
Reviews.Content: Great decor, and fab location, close to cable cars, and union square! Rooms are cute, but not modern...eclectic old school decor, could be modernized but definitely quaint. The lobby and bar are fun, and staff are very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Welshjon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rex for 3 nights in July - the staff were very friendly and helpful and at the right price the hotel offers excellent value for money. Wi Fi, tea and coffee each morning and a generous glass of wine each evening are all included. Location is also very good - a few minutes from Union Square. Any criticism is offset by the price of the hotel - the hotel is bit tired in places and our room was fine but you could hear the lift, the bed wasn't great and a basic and noisy air conditioning unit made regulating room temperature difficult. We had, however, booked one of the more basic rooms so others may be different. Given that we were paying around £100/night these comments should be taken in context. The Rex is a hotel that makes you feel welcome and seems to be a good budget option in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Jess8255
Reviews.Content: Very familiar hotel. As I used to be a travel agent, the hotels I experienced ever in SF were well-known, large-scaled, completely equipped. But they were high price hotels like Hyatt, Hilton, etc, and served by unfriendly staff. This trip was non business trip. I picked up some small and well-located hotels. The reason why I selected this hotel was reasonable room rate and availability. Frankly speaking I had not so big expectation before arrival. A very smaill doors facing to Sutter St. was as I imagined. However, Elegant interior of lobby, friendly front desk agents, comfortable beds and clean bathroom, sophisticated amenities surprised us so much !! Besides, a bar counter eased wife and me very softly in the afternoon. Other guests and temporary visitors seemed to love the bar and female bartender. I asked front desk to arrange a kind and driver with a mild nature to SF airport because an Indian taxi driver from the airport to the hotel had been the worst. Hotel called a town car driven by a chinese driver. He was OK. The fare was $50.00. Please pay attention deeply when you sit down on a chair near the front desk. A white object ont the chair is not a cushion, but a pug whose name is Max !! A front desk agent told me, " He is a hotel dog". Despite two overnight stay, the hotels became the most memorable hotel to us. We come again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: as510
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel rex were so accommodating. I booked 2 rooms at this hotel one for me and my boyfriend and another for 2 of my friends. I called at 6:00am and they let my two friends who had been driving all night have an immediate check in. No other hotel would do that. When I arrived late at night the guy at the receptionist was very nice and helpful. Great location. Small rooms but manageable for a couple not so much for a family. I really enjoyed the boutique hotel feel. I get really claustrophobic in hotels where the windows don't open. I really enjoyed sitting on the window sill by the fire escape and listening to the city buzz by. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little claustrophobic ...”
Reviews.Author: theatheathea
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel, but the rooms are small and would be terribly claustrophobic except for the fact that the window could be opened. We had a double double room, so I assume it was one of the largest, and it was still too small. We liked the atmosphere, the staff, and ... the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base in SF!”
Reviews.Author: casasdave
Reviews.Content: In town for SF Pride weekend. Great home base for festivities and discovering the city, during first time visit. Service was great, check in was swift and reception made me feel like they were awaiting my arrival. There was an instant feeling of warmth and calm upon entry into hotel from the busting downtown city streets. Plus we got to instantly greet Max the Hotel mascot Pug! Too cute! Common areas and hotel room were impeccably clean and very well maintained, making for an extremely comfortable stay. Rooms were nicely lit and had some modern touches without loosing comfort and charm. Our 3rd floor King Executive was a bit smaller than our Texas standards we are used to, but comfortable with sofa to relax on, and armoire for ample luggage storage. Hotel was easy to find, easily accessible to all modes of transportation. Muni and Bart subway station is only a few blocks down. Grabbed a taxi near hotel entry, and made it to fisherman's wharf in minutes. Had reliable and good eats at Lori's Diner just down the block, and Sotano Grill, just up the hill on Powell St, both minutes walk from hotel. All the shopping you could want just over a block and half away at Union Square. Would highly recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great experience.”
Reviews.Author: cwb631
Reviews.Content: So I booked through priceline for this hotel. This was not a bid, I was paying for the hotel upon check-out. In spite of confirming my reservation with the hotel, upon arrival, I discovered that instead of an executive king room, they had booked us in a room with two doubles. Since our class of room was unfortunately occupied, they offered to put us up in the executive suite for two nights if we'd be willing to stay in the double for one night. I thought this was fair and agreed especially since I did not know if this was their's or priceline's fault. The next day, upon preparing to move, we discovered that we were not getting the suite, but instead the room we should have originally had. The suite was and always had been booked. Needless to say I was annoyed. Now to be fair, the hotel did more than make up for the inconvenience by offering us complimentary parking for one night, breakfast for three, and a discount on the room. If this was the end of my experience, I probably would have given the hotel 4 stars. However, that evening, we asked the front desk the best way to get to Fishermans Wharf from where we were in Union Square. We were assured that a cab would be at least $20 and that the most economical way was the trolley line. 90 minutes later on the trolley to go 2-3 miles showed me the cab was probably the best bet. That evening the $9 cab ride we took in absolute gridlock showed me they had no idea what they were talking about. The next morning, the girl at our complimentary buffet breakfast forgot to keep checking the food and practically everything ran out. This for a buffet they charge I believe $15 or more for. The final straw was at checkout. We had a very early flight and at 4:30 in the morning, a friend of ours discovered she had been charged for the entire mini bar at $200. This was after the hotel offered to empty it so that she could use the fridge. Instead of resolving this quickly, the front desk needed to delete each and every item individually. Ugh! I will say, the hotel is very clean and pretty, and the location is great. Thankfully, we obtained a great rate, and they were accommodating with the room change. However, I would have been very upset if I was paying their usual rates for the experience we had.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a Fantastic City”
Reviews.Author: HidWoen
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for 10 nights and it was a great experience. We booked through Expedia after comparing the different hotels in SF on Tripadvisor. After I booked it, I saw it was recommended in the Lonely Planet aswell. We stayed on the 7th floor (top) and the room was nice, clean and quiet. The location is great, near a cable car stop, Loehman's and the Paul Frank store in the same street just two blocks away. Union Square on 2 minute walking distance were you can find Macy's and other stores. A bus stop a minute away, with line 2 and 3, who, by example, bring you to Japantown. BART and MUNI station 7 minutes away. You can walk to Chinatown in 10 minutes. We also used a bus stop that is 5 minutes away to get to the old Italian district in North Beach with great restaurants. But there is more! The hotel offers a range of free extra's, which are really great: - Complimentary Coffee and Tea to go in the morning untill 10 am - Wine Hour, every day between 5 and 6 pm. As a guest of the hotel you get a complimentary glass of wine everyday - Bikes! The hotel has 2 free bikes that you can use to cycle the hills of SF or go downhill to the Piers and then over the Golden Gate Bridge. Just make a reservation at the Front Desk a day before and (if available) you can ride them all day - On the website of the joie de vivre hotels you can find a 'Volunteer Greeter Program' section. A a guest of the hotel, you can book a complimentary walking tour with a local from San Francisco. It's not guaranteed and you have to book on-line in advance, but we did and we had a great 2 hours with someone who really knows the city - If you want to skip maintenance/housekeeping for a day, you will be rewarded with a 5$ gift card from the Hotel Bar. Great to try the City Fog Coffee. I can go on, talking but I think you'll get the point by now. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Because it's not a big hotel, the service is very personal. We loved the city, did all the tourist things, went a day out in the wine country, saw a baseball game, celebrated the 4th of july at the pears near the ferry building and even did a day trip to Yosemite Park with Extranomical Tours. There are a lot of good restaurants, and you can almost in eat in every language. Last thing: Don't stand in the lines at the cable car turnaround. That line is the biggest tourist trap of SF. You can easily get stuck there for more then an hour. Luckily someone warned us before our trip out there, so we just walked one stop away from the turn around and got on without waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShilohinBC
Reviews.Content: A friend and i stayed at this hotel when we were in San Francisco for the Wagner Ring cycle. The price of the hotel room and its central location in the city made this hotel our choice. Being close to all transportation especially the cable car and buses was a plus. The hotel offered free tea and coffee all day at the bar, daily San Francisco and New York newspapers, and a chance to pet and pose for photos with Maximus whenever he was available. One night the guests were treated to free wine and cheese. A $5 coupon for use in the bar/dining room is available if one decides to forgo housekeeping services for the day. All the staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room was decorated in the same Bloomsbury style as the rest of the hotel. It was fairly large with two double beds. The only drawback to my stay here is that on two separate nights, our neighbours were very noisy around 3-4 a.m. and I had to call reception. The walls are thin in the hotel. Other than that, definitely the Rex is a hotel I could recommend and one I would stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Rex hotel's ambience is special”
Reviews.Author: Polevaulterchicago
Reviews.Content: Not only are the staff and maids knowledgable and helpful but there are two bicycles available at all times -free. There is a Matisse-like feeling everywhere: on the lamps, walls and furniture. Good books line the walls of several common rooms. Free NYT and SF papers are put out daily but best of all is the Sutter and Powell Street location from where one can walk the city. We made the Opera House walk , for example on five occasions during our nine night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our kind of place; maybe yours too”
Reviews.Author: museumgoer
Reviews.Content: If you like a small, quiet, traditionally comfortable (as opposed to trendy or "cutting edge") hotel, conveniently located off the better side of Union Square, this is it. There's a subdued, dark-wood, clubby feel to the place, with books and literary references scattered throughout (the bar/breakfast room is called The Library and feels like one). Our king-bedded room was quite ample in size, comfortably furnished, and laid out so even a klutz like me won't bump into things. The front desk staff was courteous and efficient even though there was usually just one person at any given time (come to think of it, the one elevator was also efficient). Housekeeping was unobtrusive and thorough - everything replaced which should be replaced, everything left undisturbed which should be left undisturbed, and the job accomplished around our erratic comings and goings. Breakfast could be improved but there are many outside alternatives in close proximity. All in all, a pleasant, relaxing, and totally satisfactory stay. Highly recommended if you don't need or want crowds, action, and minimalist/metal and glass/sharp edges trendiness.

Reviews.Title: “SO CHARMING”
Reviews.Author: HotPantsMalone
Reviews.Content: The Rex is great! Super charming, old-fashioned little hotel in a great area. The staff was REALLY friendly, and the rooms are a good sized for the age of the building. The interiors are quirky (in a good way) and not at all like a cookie-cutter hotel, which is PERFECT in a town like SF. Really clean, very very charming AND free wine in the evening and free coffee in the morning! I loved the Rex and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: stephisyourfriend
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Rex for 4 nights at the beginning if a honeymoon road trip. The front desk staff were excellent and kindly gave us free champagne and breakfast for 1 day as a honeymoon gift. The rooms aren't huge but are very well decorated with lovely bathrooms and huge tv's. The hotel is really central and is very handy for union square and the shopping facilities - a bit of moneyed area so be prepared to spend. Couldn't fault this excellent hotel and would definitely stay again if I went back to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay in delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dr_mucus
Reviews.Content: Medium size room on 6th floor was SO quiet. I loved it. Nice clean bathroom. $5 credit at their bar if you skip maid service for the day. sweet dog to pet down in main lobby. good safe location. easy access to trolley but we mostly walked. Highly recommended. We switched to the much more expensive Hotel Fairmont 3 blocks away after a couple of days because we were joining up with family for a wedding party. We so prefered the quiet and charm of the Hotel Rex not to mention the $50/day lower price. Highly recommended. We arrived at the Hotel Rex late one night and their bar was closed. We asked about getting a drink and the front desk worker suggested "Cantina" next door for "culinary cocktails". It was a small bar with exotic cocktails from tequilla and other South American liquors. Great fun to chose, watch them make and savor.

Reviews.Title: “A birthday to remember”
Reviews.Author: feeblefawn
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rex was extremely accommodating and made my friend and I feel right at home. The room was quaint with a sweet little view of the streets below. The location of the hotel was perfect, considering my birthday dinner was at Millenium, only a few blocks walking distance. The staff, especially Orion, seemed to go out of their way to assure a comfortable stay for us and did everything in their power to keep it that way. Thanks Hotel Rex! I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Mariago13
Reviews.Content: Great location- shopping, restaurants. puplic transprtation are all literally steps from the door. Room was very clean; bed comfortable; service excellent; room service delicious and quick. The only thinkg that wasn't great was the wifi- it was a little slow/spotty in our room but fine at the bar. The Library Bar offered a free glass of wine per guest nightly during a designated time. We were able to enjoy this a couple of times and the wine was very nice, the atmosphere in the bar relaxing- we sank into some comfy leather chairs, ordered some cheese and crackers with our wine and rested our feet after a long day walking around San Francisco. Breakfast was very good. Coffee was very good, too. Loved the decor. Front desk staff was very helpful with directions, arranging trips and generally making us feel very welcome. We found a great room rate on a travel web site, but I would pay full room price to stay here if I were to return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but windows that can be opened ... great location.”
Reviews.Author: PocketCheese
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, old fashioned, artsy, boutique hotel a block from Union Square. We only stayed one night, but the staff was welcoming and cheerful. Obviously they enjoy their jobs. Yes, we would stay there again, but only if they can offer a bigger room. Ours was a deluxe double, and it was only because the window could be opened that it wasn't claustrophobic. Next time we'll go for a suite somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: frecklamy
Reviews.Content: We got really lucky, this hotel being on a fantastic deal with Expedia. So we didn't pay a fortune for it and weren't expecting anything near as good as we got! Excellent service from reception, loved the book-themed decor, brilliant location and the rooms were great - not huge but more than big enough for a base to explore the city. The only negative was the hotel restaurant. We were really tired on our first night so just chose to eat there. The food was fine, but it was deadly quiet in there. There only being three people eating there obviously isn't the hotel's fault, but they sat us altogether which made it a bit weird as you could hear everything everyone was saying. Would've been good to either spread people out a bit and/or put a bit of background music on for some privacy! Otherwise I can't fault this hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly, clean, comfortable hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: cmor
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this very friendly hotel in downtown San Francisco. The staff couldn't have been more helpful - answering loads of questions about where to go (and not go), what to see and do. They made dinner reservations for me, gave me a free glass of wine after long days walking and switched my room when I couldn't sleep. It was perfect for a solo traveller - safe, friendly, clean and welcoming. I'll definately be returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - exceeded my expectation - great value in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: AngelaBax
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Rex after reading mostly positive reviews on Tripadvisor - and was pleasantly suprised by the comfort and size of the rooms along with the great staff service. The price for the location was great - the hotel is in the neighbourhood of much more pricy options - close to all public transport and one block from Union Square. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely SF location”
Reviews.Author: CharlieDogUk
Reviews.Content: Brilliant stay was upgraded to executive suite at front desk on checkin as it was our honeymoon. Tasteful decoration, spacious room, great bar with complementary red wine, had a really good burger here of all things! Would recommend to any couple visiting SF as the central location is brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful old hotel, wonderful art collection, great service, sweet dog!”
Reviews.Author: cinzia2011
Reviews.Content: The location is particularly great, within walking distance to many neighborhhods.
