The bar is a great place to congregate with friends and enjoy happy hour (complimentary wine for guests). The art on the walls was more interesting than other hotels that boast an art collection! Finally, you must have your photo taken with Maximo the pug!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Dreklaw
Reviews.Content: Wife and I usually stay at the Grand Hyatt when we are in SF but decided to try the Rex instead to save a little money.  We are glad we did. The staff was polite and helpful, our room was clean and comfortable with all of the expected amenities, and was reasonably quiet considering the central location. WiFi was included, our bed was warm and cozy, and the shower had lots of hot water with good towels. The free glass of wine in the evening was a nice touch. We decided to forego the valet parking and stowed our car in the Union Square garage instead,  a short walk from the hotel, which saved us even more. If you go, please say Hi to Maximo for us; he will be in the lobby in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with character to boot!”
Reviews.Author: ronrush
Reviews.Content: This is a small-ish boutique hotel which serves free wine from 5-6pm daily. Hotel is about 10min walk to Powell St. Bart station. You could also take the cablecar to Fisherman's Wharf easily. Slept well and Walgreens is just at the corner - perfect for picking up snacks and drinks. I love the free Wi-Fi!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Nicola K
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but very very hot. We arrived in the middle of a heat wave and baked for the next three days. Staff were very knowledgable and friendly. A free glass of wine at the bar every night is a great added extra. Great Location, just above Union Square

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: northowl
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on other reviews and having good experience with other hotels by Joie de Vivre. But my, was I disappointed: - Rooms were noisy, especially from guests walking upstairs. - The rooms were cold, cold, cold and heating was down but they chose not to disclose it. My colleague got a heater, but I apparently checked in too late to get one. - They had lost my reservation when I arrived (although they could see it in their system). The clerk suggested that I was lucky they had a room, not sorry that they'd lost it. - Reception area and halls resembled a typical upscale motel. On the positive side, it is a good location and rooms were clean. I've traveled the entire world, but this was one of my worst nights of sleep ever (I feel suddenly tired just thinking of it).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: frankfurtzagreb
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very near to Union Square and 10-minute walk from underground station with direct line to the airport. Just around the corner you can take cable car to Fisherman's Wharf which is quite nice. Most importantly rooms were clean and we were very satisfied with the staff. Highly recommendable, especially if you can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but sad ending....”
Reviews.Author: WesternCanadaTrish
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I had a wonderful and relaxing trip. Be careful of pick picketers in this area. I thought I was being very careful about to make sure this didn't happen, please take precautionary measures. We still had a wonderful trip, but a very frustrating ending to our trip due to thieves.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a good rate, it's a great deal”
Reviews.Author: ootanaboot
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel at a great rate, so it was a very good deal. Clean, cozy rooms, excellent staff (full of suggestions, always accommodating). In a great location, we hopped on and off the trolley at the end of the block throughout the entire stay - the Walgreen's on the corner sells passes. The place is small but totally acceptably small for being in a big city (and I have been in WAAAY smaller boutique hotels). And it really makes up for it in style.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bethanylou
Reviews.Content: I was recommended to this chain of Hotels, and the Rex was the one I chose. This was my first time to San Fran and the staff were very helpful, friendly and very knowledgeable. The complimentary wine at night was fantastic, and Dave the barman had many tips and guides for a solo female traveller. The rooms were quaint, clean, and overall I would recommend this Hotel. The location is also fabulous, right near the Cable Car stop, Union Square and the muni bus line.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect San Francisco hotel, with a warm and hospitable staff”
Reviews.Author: defro
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic stay. We were going to spend just two nights and travel on, but ended up staying for four since we liked it so much. The location is perfect and the hotel seems to be a magnet for creative and nice people; in a sense, it's an embodiment of the city itself. The decore is artistic and the place has a very literary appeal. The staff--Zack, Jeff, Orion and everyone else--are really helpful and friendly. The overall feel of the hotel is accomodating and relaxed--what a nice switch from the cold and soul-less business hotels I often stay in when I travel for work. And of course there is that free glass of (good) wine you get each night...

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Welsh_Bex
Reviews.Content: This little boutique hotel is in a great location (literally a 2 minute walk from union square). It was quiet and laid back (even a free wine hour every evening!) This was a really charming hotel. The rooms were exceptionally clean with large, incredibly comfortable beds, a huge t.v (not that we used it much as we were too busy seeing San Fran - which is an amazing city I should add) and an immaculate (and large) bathroom (hair-dryer & nice toiletries included). The décor of the rooms is a bit quirky but it was a refreshing change from the usual homogeneous hotel room! The hotel has a gorgeous little bar/restaurant, styled like an antique library with lots of heavy books and dark wood everywhere. They do a happy hour where your first glass of wine is free and the food is very tasty although we only had a small snack there the first night after our long flight from the UK. We dined elsewhere the rest of our stay but that was just because we wanted to try everything! The Cheesecake Factory at the top of Macy's in Union Square is worth a mention for dinner and extravagant cheesecakes although we did wait an hour for our table (a good excuse for a look around Macy's). There isn't any breakfast included but there are great places to eat everywhere, a couple of doors down is Lori's Diner which is a novelty 50's style diner, entertaining for tourists and children (there is a car in the middle of the diner and lots of 50's memorabilia) I wasn't expecting a lot from the breakfast but i was pleasantly surprised! We had huge portions of pancakes with loads juicy strawberry's and whipped butter (A holiday treat!) and the men had streaky bacon, eggs, hash browns etc, worth a visit! We mainly used the hotel as a base for sightseeing - we were up fairly early and out seeing all the sights e.g Alcatraz, Fisherman's Wharf, Golden Gate Bridge, Chinatown, Union Square, Coit Tower, Lombard St, Washington Sq Park and a little bit of window shopping in Tiffany's! The trams are also fun to take a ride on although there were huge queues everytime. The streets can be unbelievably steep but rewarding views are definitely worth it, esp from the top of coit tower ! The weather was warm but a really bitter wind everyday so a jacket with sunglasses was necessary! There aren't amenities like a swimming pool etc at this hotel but for a city break I think that is a charming hotel right in the centre of everything. San Francisco one of the best places I have ever visited and Hotel Rex was outstanding. I will be visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: LHC20
Reviews.Content: Booked Hotel Rex online directly with the hotel, so didn't know what to expect. TA reviews were all very positive so that was a plus. We had booked a double double room as our son was travelling with us. Room was clean and housekeeping staff was great. Our friends booked a king room and this was much bigger than our room. It is a small boutique hotel located very close to Union Square, Macy's and many other stores. We even walked to Chinatown. Free WiFi was available as well. iWould definitely stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “LOVING the REX”
Reviews.Author: amymad
Reviews.Content: Discovered the Rex a few years ago when we got priced out of the Monaco and the Triton. Now, we wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else. Everything about it is, for me, perfect. Location just a half block from Powell Street cable car (we always ask for a room on a high floor on the Powell Street side so we can hear the cable car bells -- you know you are in the city!) is convenient to Union Square. Walking distance to MOMA. Cabs are easy to hail on Sutter Street. The rooms are clean and decorated with flair. The public areas, with a literary salon vibe, are soothing with touches of poetry and whimsy. And the staff is always -- and I mean always -- pleasant and helpful. Front desk Jeff is all that with personality plus. And you don't have to break the bank for a nice room. I would live in this hotel if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Sure!”
Reviews.Author: SACALosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We go to San Francisco once or twice a year and have stayed very often at another boutique hotel. Last year we had a bad experience and decided to try something else. We like the area to the west of Union Square and prefer small boutique hotels or b&bs. We chose the Hotel Rex and loved it. Wonderful location. Terrific ambience. Great staff. Everything was perfect. Lovely bar for a drink before heading off to dinner or coming back for a nightcap. We noticed that several people ordered food to be served at the bar. Though we did not, we could easily see how much they enjoyed it. We had a short walk to several top notch restaurants and just a block from one of the main cable car routes. The room that we had was a little small, but fine for us as we don't stay much in the room other than sleep. Don't know if all the rooms are the same size. It was fine. The staff was always friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable. The Hotel Rex was a great choice for sure! We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with ambiance to stay in the center of San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: malinowynet
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed in this hotel in December 2010. The biggest advantage is the location, with only 5 minutes to Union Square (shopping), Hilton (conferences) and Market St. (shopping, restaurants). A lot of tourist attractions are also within walking distance, for further ones you can catch the cable car around the corner. The atmosphere of the hotel is great, with welcoming staff and free glass of wine at the hotel bar. There is a nice bar/cafe on the ground floor with comfortable armchairs and books. The rooms are quite small, but have everything you need, including very comfortable beds and large flat-screen TV. We had a room on the 3rd floor with view on the wall of the neighbouring building - no view, but very quiet at night. The free internet connection was working fine, even for video-calls. All in all, very nice hotel for short or longer stays in San Francisco with the ambiance and location as the biggest assets. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good locaion but quite cold”
Reviews.Author: NathaliePaul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December.The hotel is well located. Many cafés ans restaurants available on Sutter street and around. But, the room was cold. We could not adjust the heat in the room because it was a central heat system. On top of that, the water was warm not hot so we could not warm ourselves with a good hot shower. We could also clearly hear the street noise even though we were located on the 8th floor. It was so bad that we tought that the windows were opened on the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Older style property, well kept and great location”
Reviews.Author: Mac50Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Rex in Oct 2010 at the start of a 2 week touring holiday. We had room 602 which is a king room at the back and overlooks an internal square with other buildings/trees, so the traffic noise was just a distant hum, which was great. Perhaps we were lucky with considerate neighbours, but we also didn’t hear any noise from adjoining rooms. It’s a great location – easy walking distance from Union Square, the Westfield Mall in Market Street and a few minutes walk to the cable car stop. The hotel is an older style property, not modern, but well kept. Our room was spacious and comfortable and there was free wifi available. It’s quite a small hotel, so there is no doorman, but the reception staff were pleasant and helpful. Between 5pm and 6pm, you can get a free glass of wine in the lobby bar and one of the nights we were there, they had a classical quartet playing. We booked through whatahotel.com and had vouchers for breakfast, so ate at Café Andre, part of the hotel. It’s quite a small room, but lots of choice for breakfast and the food and service were great.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but nice, and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mikefil58
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in conjunction with my wife's company's holiday party. We had my daughter and a friend of hers, both 12 years old, with us. We all enjoyed it very much. The hotel is funky and small, with a literary theme. There are quotes from famous authors on the stair landings and the bar/restaurant is called "The Library". We liked our room a lot, which is to be expected as we had one of the two suites the hotel offers. There was a good-sized living room with a foldout couch, a good-sized bedroom, and two bathrooms. The bed was comfy, with high quality sheets. The bathrooms were well-appointed as well. We had no problems with cleanliness but my wife's boss's room was full of dirty glasses and such when he checked in, so one cleanliness star deducted for that. We saw one other room that was not terribly small by San Francisco standards but a couple of the people there with us mentioned that their rooms were shoe-box sized. If you like a larger room, you might want to check on this when you make your reservations. The location is excellent - on Sutter just a block or so off of Union Square. It's pretty hard not to have fun in that neighborhood. There's a free glass of wine for each guest offered in The Library at 5:00 each day. Our first night there, they had a string quartet followed by a jazz singer to accompany the wine. This was really nice and we enjoyed both acts a lot. They offer light food and cocktails in The Library as well as the wine, and the bartender is good at what he does. If you stay here, don't miss out on this. Employees were all very friendly and willing to help with whatever we needed. One of the guys working the front desk had his dog there (a pug named Max) who delighted my daughter and her friend. (The life of a hotel lobby dog is one we can all aspire to in our future lives.) I don't know exactly what the company paid for these rooms, but my understanding is that they were quite a bit cheaper than The Four Seasons and such. If that's the case, then I'd say the Rex scores pretty high on the value side of things. Bottom line: This is a really great place for people who like hotels with character and individuality. It's not wildly luxurious but it's plenty nice and the employees really make staying there a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay nowhere else in SF”
Reviews.Author: KileOzier
Reviews.Content: Seriously, from the moment one enters, one is welcomed...and from the second visit, one is welcomed by name. It is refurbished, "old San Francisco" in the style of a mansion library. Cozy and warm, evening music in the lobby lounge, coffee in the morning and wine in the evening, barely a block from Union Square, exceptionally good rates and free wifi (ahem, FREE wifi throughout the hotel), lots of hot water, roomy bathrooms and GREAT beds. A disparate clientele guarantees good off-the-cuff conversation in elevator or restaurant, should you be so inclined; but all staff are warmly polite and professional and as friendly as one is open for them to be. I am returning to SF for a convention taking place at the Fairmont; but I'm staying at the Rex.

Reviews.Title: “Average not boutique”
Reviews.Author: chris1jadesfire
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at noon for a two night stay at the end of a tour of California and were pleased that the room was ready and we could check in. It was however quite a small, basic room without a great deal of character and less facilities than other hotels which we have stayed in during out two week trip. There was no safe or tea/coffee making facilities. Location was ok for the shopping area and cable car, however a long way from the tourist areas of the waterfront (at least 45mins walk). The hotel served breakfast (not included in our rate) and bar meals and provided complementary coffee in the morning, however these services were cancelled on our last day due to Thanksgiving. Surely if a hotel is open on a public holiday it should offer these basic services?!...

Reviews.Title: “Cute Little Hotel Near Everything”
Reviews.Author: chrism4549
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a few days and really enjoyed it. The plus side, it's near everything, very affordable, over a hundred years old with some quirks (which we think is fun). The staff was nice and they have a wine reception every evening. Some of the drawbacks for others might be the small rooms given the age of the hotel. It's also a little creaky and loud in there. Also, the food from room service was lackluster at best. Given the location and price and what was offered, we thought it was a great place and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, real charm”
Reviews.Author: EmandDee
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rex has a stunning location very near Union Square and the cable cars. It's a small but lovely hotel with very well chosen decor, comfortable rooms (not very large but there's lots to do out and about in SF) and its greatest asset is its fantastic reception staff who are super efficient, really friendly and warm. The complimentary coffee in Reception in the morning is handy. One note of caution: the bar staff expect full 18% tips even though they don't bring drinks to your table. Best local breakfast is Lola's Diner (five minutes from Rex to the left). Would certainly check out a Joie de Vivre hotel in future.

Reviews.Title: “The little hotel that could!”
Reviews.Author: CodgersontheMove
Reviews.Content: A comfy, small hotel with a European feel to it. The location is superb, one block off Union Square and a half block to a cable car line. The best thing about the Hotel Rex, though, is the friendly and knowledgable staff, accommodating to the nth degree. ( They recommended Fino Ristorante to us, which was within easy walking distance of the hotel, and Fino turned out to be an excellent choice, rated #5 among 3,000 restaurants in San Fran.) The rooms were adequate in size and very clean. We experienced no outside noise, since our room did not face Sutter Street. We particularly enjoyed the complimentary wine in the lobby from 5-6 pm. The hotel has an interesting array of art work all over, and the lamp shades in the rooms are hand-painted. All in all, a nifty little hotel with heart.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel just off Union Square”
Reviews.Author: briand69
Reviews.Content: We kicked off our 3 week holiday with a few days in San Francisco. The hotel staff were friendly and fast. After a long flight a painless check in is always a good time. The rooms are small but perfect with a good shower and TV/ fridge facilities. The only downside was the rooms get very hot (it was not summer either.) It is worth the price as it is a great location to discover the city from

Reviews.Title: “Rex is great”
Reviews.Author: tramwj
Reviews.Content: I love Hotel Rex. I've stayed here 2 times, and each time was great. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I believe my wife and I were given one of the bigger rooms during each of our stays, so we were happy with the room size, and the queen size bed was large enough for us. The rooms we stayed in were quiet, I never heard a peep at night, but our room was not facing Sutter St on either visit. The bed was very comfortable. The complimentary wine is nice for wine drinkers, and the bartender was very nice as well. Would definitely recommend to others, and will gladly stay at Rex again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel in fabulous San Francisco Location”
Reviews.Author: nealeychica
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed Hotel Rex upon the recommendation of a close friend and former colleague. The hotel itself is in an older building with a classic "New Yorker" feel. The rooms are completely updated and include great complimentary toiletries. Most importantly the service was superb. I was greeted right away by a very friendly hotel employee, I needed a last minute extension and change to my room which she handled very efficiently. Parking is not the greatest in Union Square area, but there is a garage around the corner that offered parking for about $10.00 less than area competitors. If you have the time and know the area, you can find street parking in Knob Hill area and walk to the hotel:):)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, with friendly staff helpful.”
Reviews.Author: drunkglaseweig
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rex and his wife, I was on vacation in August last. It is a hotel with high standards of hospitality services. When they arrived at the hotel we were welcomed with smiles. They help us bring more luggage room and they always ask do I need to add anything else? Very clean rooms and corridors vay.Cach room decorated in yellow do always get the feeling the warmth. Streets safe and clean. I will definitely return and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the best bed”
Reviews.Author: Travel1327
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Rex in October and the staff was so accomodating, the room and bathroom very clean, but the best part was the bed. I haven't slept through the night in years do to health problems, but this bed was so comfortable I slept over 8 hours without waking once. The hotel is just steps from the Sir Francis Drake and the cable cars. The wine served at the happy hour was excellent, which surprised us after spending 5 days in the wine country. We were also treated to a wonderful concert by a middle school string quintet. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to stay in a convenient location with great beds.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dac2800
Reviews.Content: The Rex was a massive disappointment, I feel as though those who stayed here were at a different hotel. it was like a bad version of Fawlty Towers. One, our room was the size of a large closet - and apparently it's the largest queen room they have. On top of that, it was dirty and run down. Two, the staff was rude. They forgot a sheet on our bed, and when we complained said it's supposed to be that way.

Reviews.Title: “More than average ! Good for any plan !”
Reviews.Author: Tinaangela
Reviews.Content: Never been here before and decided to give it a go as it has so many good reviews. It's centrally located to Union Square and strangely it offers a nice 1940's decoration style. HOwever, the old style doesnt mean the standard is low. it is very clean. The staff are friendly. However, they misunderstood us sometimes. A minor point, but keep checking on them if u ask them for a favour. We asked for the double room, but they gave us a wrong key and what we got was probably usually a 1 person room , 1 small double bed. However, they changed it immediately. I think cause the reviews are very good, i expect little bit too high. HOwever, it is still more than average and a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our Californian odyssey”
Reviews.Author: bellini6
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights at Hotel Rex at the start of a 3 week touring holiday. Great location- took BART from airport to Powell and walked the 5 blocks up hill to Sutter. Pleasant friendly greeting at Reception. Our room on 7th floor was warm and welcoming. Very comfortable bed and large bathroom. The combination lock on my suitcase wouldn't open - a very helpful guy (a janitor) took my husband and the case down to the basement and prised it open!! We ate breakfast in the hotel dining room on 2 mornings. Altogether I would recommend the hotel for business or leisure with its friendly staff and great location (2-3 blocks to Union Square and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Shelly77096
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and despite the outward appearance (vacant shop unit next door) we were pleasantly surprised by this quirky hotel. The staff, especially on Reception, we re extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice staff, loved it.”
Reviews.Author: iceward
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and loved every minute. We were made to feel welcome on check-in and even received a free upgrade. Our room had a very comfy super size bed with a perfectly adequate ensuite bathroom. We had a little trouble working out the light switches in the room, but nothing to worry about. The hotel is right in the centre with a 1 minute walk to the tram line down to Fishermans Wharf. Valet parking is expensive ($35 /day) but still cheaper than other places. The bar area provided live entertainment and free wine each evening we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly helpful staff, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrJohn1960
Reviews.Content: What a great place. I was really looking forward to staying here after reading reviews and I was not disapointed. We arrived late afternoon and the check in was professional, welcoming and friendly. We timed it well as we were advised that the complimentary glass of wine was available very shortly. The wine served is good and not a free glass of rubbsh plonk!. I had contacted the Rex prior to our visit as we were staying in San Francisco for our wedding anniversary. We congratulated on our anniversary and were given a voucher for an additional complimentary drink of our choice at the bar and a room upgrade to a king sized bed. The room was a good size and compared to hotels we have experienced in Boston and NYC the bathroom was large. If there was one complaint the shower needs more power. The location is perfect, absolutely ideal for getting around this lovely city. The staff are friendly and helpful amd we were always greated with a warm smile. The advice given was always good and you felt as though you were important and not being an inconvenience. To top it off we met Max and have the pleasure of having him as a facebook friend with our photo added. If I ever returned to San Francisco I would return here.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was excellent and would...”
Reviews.Author: SAmberJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent and would certainly stay again if visiting san Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel & staff brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Norma5196
Reviews.Content: Although rooms are on the small side, decor etc more than made up for this. Just a short walk from Union Square. The staff were some of the most helpful and friendliest we have ever come across. In the early evening between 5 & 6 the have a a free glass of house wine, which can be very much appreciated after a day of sightseeing,if you do not drink there is tea or coffee. I would recommend this Hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for city stay”
Reviews.Author: chronograph
Reviews.Content: We just love the REX ! We stayed there (again) for two nights before we took off for a trip through CA and Nevada and we really like the atmosphere in the hotel. It has charme, the reception staff is very friendly, chatty and helpful. And: meet MAXIMO the dog and mascot of the hotel (we were told the dog has its own facebook page. True ?? ) The breakfast was great (bit pricey), restaurant quality very good (we had room service as we were pretty tired, arriving from a long overseas flight). The arty bar offered to us a complimentary drink after arrival. Check-out was pretty late without problems, valet parking for the rental car was no worries (I believe it was 35 USD per day) and the location can't be much better for SF's city centre. I actually can't think of anything really bad about this hotel except our room's view at the neighbouring brickwalled backyard. We will be back !

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay - central spot”
Reviews.Author: liz55
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights in this hotel.It is based on Sutter Street which is just off Union Square. This is a very central spot and an ideal base to travel around San Francisco. The rex is a very friendly hotel. On first impression it seemed a bit glum - but it wasn't that was the 1920s style decor. Our room was large for american standards, the bathroom was also large, clean with a good shower and a good quality hair dryer. There are no tea making facilities in the rooms, but the hotel provides these during the morning free in the lounge area. The hotel also provided guests with a glass of wine every evening between 5 and 6 pm. Breakfast was not included in our price but we chose to eat breakfast in their restaurant every day (except 1) and we found them to be substantial. There are other places close by to eat though. I would definitely stay again oin this hotel So a bit about San Francisco. Union Square is a shoppers paradise with Macy's in the square. I recommend you visit the Cheesecake factory in Macy's. The restaurant is worth a visit for is decor - but the cheesecakes are huge and the cocktails we had were also very good. In one of the side streets just off Union Square there was a small diner called Maccos which served delicious food at lunch time and very good value for money. we ate there 4 times. it has tables and chairs in the streets and the street has gates on so just look for it - opposite the cafe in union square itself. Tour buses leave from Union Square and we used these to familiarise ourselves with San Francisco. Travbelling across Golden Gate bridge and every other area in the city. There were 4/5 different trips adnyou could get a reduced price for 48 hours - they gave us an extra day free. The cable trams are a must but these cost 5$ per journey. You can buy a daily ticket for 13$, a 3 day ticket for 20$ adn a 7 day ticket for 26$ - extremely good value. These tickets allow you to travel on the cable cars, buses, trams and muni (underground system). A trip to Alcatraz is a must and th etours are very good. You need to book these before you go as they do get full. There are other ferry trips and we went over to Angel island and also caught the ferry to Sausalito which was a lovely town - I think you can drive here. We were not impressed by Fisherman's Wharf although this is where the ferries depart. it was smelly and a bit like a Blackpools Golden mile. the fish restaurants were overpriced for the quality and quantity of food you received. I would never eat there again. have to say, whilst we were there we had a heat wave but we were told it is usually quite cold - and you are recommend to take warm clothes to layer, San francisco has a fabulous skyline - I would say better than New Yorks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Location - 5 Stars for Hotel Rex”
Reviews.Author: Q2099
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights while on our honeymoon and found the room was warm and inviting in a unique boutique style. The location was very handy as it was 10 minutes from everywhere and was not too far up a hill so as it could be walked everday. Complimentary wine hour was a bonus, as was happy hour on Beers which included the excellent SF ale Anchor Steam. We received excellent service from Jeff who went above and beyond duty in making sure that we were happy and all of the other staff were also very friendly. Jeff also went far with great after service. We would recommend Hotel Rex to anyone who is looking for a cool SF hotel that is not overly expensive but ticks all the boxes for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Only as a back up plan”
Reviews.Author: C8282
Reviews.Content: Tricky review. I'd stayed in the Rex once before and really enjoyed it. It's centrally located to Union Square and has a nice 1940's feel to the decor. This visit was well below par. We checked in early but happy to leave our bags and return later etc for the room. When we came back we were given what was probably usually a 1 person room , 1 small double in a very small room. Toenail clipping also found on the floor. Bathroom curtain didn't cover the window so left a foot of open glass exposed. Then we had the dreaded "roll together bed". We probably should have complained but the hotel was very busy and as we were only staying 1 night we maybe got a bad deal and were too tired to argue or discuss. This is a Joie de Vivre hotel like the Drisco (which we loved) but the staff at the Rex were cocky and unapproachable and I felt the service was overall very poor. We weren't informed of anything on check-in (there is coffee, wine etc which we found out by overhearing other people later) One saving grace, I don't know the barmans name in the wine reception but he was great fun and saved the experience!

Reviews.Title: “What more can you (reasonably) ask for?”
Reviews.Author: chrismoe
Reviews.Content: The Rex is a truly a gem. The nature of my profession is that I often spend long but unpredictable stretches of time at a hotel. I look for location, quiet, great sleep experience, access to a quality health club and value. And if I can get a little charm, coziness then that's a plus. The more a hotel can feel like home, the better. I have by now spent about 30 nights at the Rex over the course of this summer and I could not be happier. If you want a lot of razzamataz look elsewhere; if you want a solid base camp for your business or pleasure trip, then check in to the Rex.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, incredible service, a MUST STAY!”
Reviews.Author: Pedisich
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Hotel Rex last weekend for our girls weekend and had an absolutely delightful experience. The service was attentive and friendly right from the start all the way through our stay. They made fabulous recommendations for food and nightlife, as we were new to the area. The hotel's location was also incredibly convenient. We had a 2 minute walk to beautiful Union Square, where we shopped and explored all there is to see. The accommodations were fantastic as well. Clean, eclectic rooms, with comfortable beds...we could have asked for nothing more. Thanks for a great stay! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: aliw1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rex for four nights and found it a great base to see San Francisco. It's close to Union Square and the cable cars, and a fairly easy walk up to Chinatown and North Beach. The staff were very helpful, giving us us good dinner suggestions and directions to various sights. The free class of wine in the evening is also a bonus, as is the free WiFi in all the rooms. It's very good value, we paid for three nights and got the fourth free. The only minor complaint I would have is that the room was very hot, and the air con was very loud to leave on during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Rex is King. Long Live the King”
Reviews.Author: julnol
Reviews.Content: We had a short but wonderful stay at the Rex. It is well located near Union Square, close to transport, shopping and restaurants. It is small and quirky rather than large and bland. Loved the free wine in the bar in the evening, and the bar itself was friendly and clubby The room was well appointed and, while it was air conditioned, we would have liked the option of regular air. Great bathroom - spacious and excellent for overnight drying (a bonus for a tourist). Cafe Andree was an ok choice for breakfast but nothing special. Female desk staff were lovely - very friendly, welcoming and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Roburetto
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the Hotel Rex and our experience was really really delightful. Check in was extremely fast, service was always willing to help you, free wine glasses were delicious (on Friday you can listen to classic music too, recommended). The rooms were quite good, not very big but had all the facilities one could need, and the room service was perfect too. It is close to Chinatown, Financial District, etc. We will definitely stay there again when we come back to San Francisco. Don't forget to take your picture with Rex if you go there!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic base in the heart of Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Gary1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights from the 29th August: What a great start to our California Road Trip this was. We arrived seriously jet-lagged from our London flight to be checked in by a really friendly guy who was able to accommodate our higher floor request. In fact all the staff we met were a credit to the hotel, as they really were a helpful and friendly bunch. The hotel is situated 5 blocks up from the Powell Bart station, which makes it ideal to get to / from the airport – I am glad we took the BART instead of a Airport shuttle as it worked out a lot cheaper and was really no hassle at all. The walk from the station to Sutter Street was as I said only 5 blocks and not that steep an incline. Overall the hotel is really central to all the Union Square action, being only minutes walk from the BART, Metro, Cable Car and F-Line trolley as well as numerous good restaurants – I cannot recommend Fino (Italian) and Colibri (Mexican) enough, as well as Sears Fine Food for breakfast. The room itself was on the 4th floor and was furnished to a high standard, including a very handy IPod docking station as well as a good size flat screen TV. Size-wise, it was more than spacious enough to meet our needs, with good storage and plenty of floor space. The queen bed was super-comfortable and certainly got the thumbs up. The en-suite bathroom was again a good size for a hotel, with a bath / shower, and was kept well stocked with the requisite toiletries. The room was maintained to a very high standard throughout our stay. The hotel also has free WIFI which is always a bonus We were fortunate enough to arrive just in time for the nightly free glass of wine between 5PM and 6PM from the hotel bar – they were serving a Chardonnay and Pinot Grigio whilst we were there, along with 1 red. The wine was served in the atmospheric, low lit lobby bar, which was like walking back into an Agatha Christie novel. The bar also offered a happy hour, which I think ran from 5pm to 7pm. This was a great way to start the evening, and was full with tourists of all nationalities and locals alike. We had breakfast in the onsite Cafe Andrée on our final day which was great. The portion size was more than adequate to see us through lunch time as well, and I can thoroughly recommend the smoked salmon hash. If you are a hotel guest, you can partake in the free coffee on offer back in the lobby bar until 10 Am. Overall I cannot fault our stay and felt the hotel offered really good value for money. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a base in Union Square, and on our stay would certainly return ourselves should we visit San Francisco again, which we would very much like to !

Reviews.Title: “Central no frills hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: olivespencer
Reviews.Content: Good central location to union sq. Decor leaves something to be desired, bathrooms outdated and small bed. Evening free wine tasting and the live music where very enjoyable. The reception staff where extremely helpful. So long as you shop around and get a good price it is worth staying.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SantaFeYo
Reviews.Content: Everything good that everyone has said about the hotel is true, what a great little gem, we loved staying here. We would repeat everything that has been said, so we just say "Book the Rex"

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and stylish”
Reviews.Author: helioPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: The minute we arrived, the Hotel Rex's staff made us feel right at home. All of the people who work there are polite and friendly. I like sitting in the library and reading all the daily newspapers in the morning with my coffee or at the end of the day, with a glass of wine. The rooms are on the small side, but clean and charmingly decorated. This was our second visit to the Hotel Rex and we would definitely stay there again. It's also exactly where I want to be in San Francisco, within easy walking distance of Nob Hill, Chinatown, Union Square, Financial district, and SFMoMA.

Reviews.Title: “Best place I've stayed in the city, bar none.”
Reviews.Author: JeffHM
Reviews.Content: I have traveled quite a bit for work, family obligations, and just to visit friends. I've come to leave my expectations at the door when it comes to hotels. Unless you have been there before, you never know what you're going to get. I was pleasantly surprised by the Hotel Rex. It's in a great location downtown just off of Union Square. It's easy to get to from the BART and MUNI train systems, a big plus coming from the airports in SF or Oakland. The is absolutely no need to rent a car unless you're travelling outside of SF. Check in was quick and the concierge staff were helpful and knowledgeable. The room was well-sized compared to other hotels in the area (Executive King) and the décor was pleasant and not overbearing. The amenities the room offers are well thought out and made using the room as a "base station" for my trip a breeze. The writing desk and free wireless internet allowed me to get work done without having to tramps down to a cafe and the couch and coffee table were a nice touch that made the room homier and more welcoming after a busy day. The bed was COMFORTABLE. The biggest complaint I have of many of the hotels downtown is that they have paper-thin walls. Traffic noise and loud newlywed neighbors are not what I want to listen to the night before I have a big day ahead of me. This was not a problem for my stay at the Hotel Rex. I didn't hear a peep from the outside world and slept like a baby. I will be staying there again and recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A really pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: shakles
Reviews.Content: We have just had a most enjoyable stay at the Hotel Rex. We didn't imagine that it would be so conveniently placed for access to the various attractions, restaurants and shopping complexes. The room was not large but adequate and very comfortable. The staff were exceptionally pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “would be nice to get my money back”
Reviews.Author: yelena64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at theHotel Rex in early July 2010, as it came highly recommended by Trip Advisor. It is, indeed, difficult to beat hotel location in the city plus its reasonable rates. I made my reservation through www.booking.com for two rooms and two nights . Upon arrival I was told that they have one reservaiton only for one night, but reception staff was gracious to take care of it. When we were leaving the bill contained items that were never used from the mini-bar menu plus each couple was charged for parking ( we had one car for 4 people). I thought that I caught this mistake on time to have it corrected but little did I know that we also would be charged twice for our stay there. I called to speak wth accounitng ofice at the hotel to have this mistake sorted out and after lengthy explanations and quite af ew phone calls was told that they " just changed/upgraded /replaced their computer system " but they will take care of my bill and get back to me the VERY next day. The conversation was handled by the Director of Operations. It has been at least two weeks since that communication , and this is still not rectified. I tried to call 4 times in the last 48 hrs and left numerous messages on various answering machines with promise to get back to me promptly. I would believe when someone will eventually get back to me. I think it is way too much aggravation for two night stay in "charming" Hotel :Rex". I guess I am not coming back

Reviews.Title: “elegant, chic', artsy, cozy and completely charming!”
Reviews.Author: liz154943
Reviews.Content: First off, I am not sure if I have ever met a warmer and more accomdating staff than at Hotel Rex. Since we bought the room off of Priceline we were given a room with a single queen-sized bed. But when we checked in they had no problem upgrading us 3 girls to king suite at no additional charge. The decor in the rooms was an added bonus. Bradley, one of the managers, spent a good deal of time with us girls telling us the in's and out's of San Fran, ensuring that we saw all the hotspots! He even hooked us up on a really cool wine tour in Napa. David, a cool and classy bartender was also equally helpful and attentive. He went out of his way to tell us about the must-do's in San Fran, and he kept the wine a flowing! Every night from 5-6, I believe, they have live entertainment and they offer you a free glass of wine. I was impressed to be at a hotel where the staff was genuinely interested in making my stay in California a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice right up until leaving”
Reviews.Author: Travelinkan
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here and found the room very comfortable. Breakfast was not amazing but there is a good bagel place (posh bagel) just down the street. The one thing that annoyed me was when leaving the concierge proposed he would call a town car as this would be cheaper than a taxi. This was anything but true and as far as I am concerned an ugly move to make an extra buck. I would not mind staying there again but would make my own travel arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spruth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our honeymoon and found this a fantastic hotel- clean, comfortable and excellent value for money. We arrived very stressed after arriving by car and dealing with an awful man at the car hire place- the hotel staff made us at ease immediately, giving us a room upgrade and glasses of champagne when they found out it was our honeymoon. We had a lovely room with an enormous bed. We loved the bar area and the wine hour and happy hour. Service at the bar was excellent- a great place to end our honeymmon- thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great 8-day stay in friendly, no-frill, and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatOttawa82
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are coming back from 8 days in SF and area. The Rex is very well located with just about everything within walking distance. The staff was very courteous and their advice for restaurantsand car rental very reliable. The room, a Queen bed room was well decorated albeit somewhat small. The complimentary wine offered late in the afternoon was a good quality and served in a cozy lobby room. In short, nothing fancy but everyrthing right. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, nice rooms but lacking natural light, friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: Organ_Donor99
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rex has the perfect location just off Union Square, couldnt be any closer to the action...We got the Rex on a deal where we stayed 3 nights and got one night free bringing the price down to a very reasonable rate so I would advise looking into whether you can obtain similar deals... The room was nice, a decent size and had a TV, Ipod player and all the other stuff you would normally expect...My main complaint about the Rex was that the bedroom had barely any natural light, we had a tiny window looking onto other rooms...It would have been nice to have a view of the street or at least be woken up by natural light rather than being continually dark and gloomy...The bathroom was a decent size and everything worked well, however some of the switches and appliances looked a little dated and I think it could be time for a refresh if I was being picky! Overall, we enjoyed our stay here...As I said, we got an excellent deal and the location is unbeatable...If only we had a little more natural light it would have got five stars across the board.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: geminigemini
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Rex is literally a block from Union Square so it is close to everything but off the main roads so it is quiet. After touring around San Francisco we decided we couldn't have picked a better location to stay. This is a very clean well run boutique hotel with all the charm you would expect. It has a small and comfy lobby with an adjoining bar (complimentary coffee and tea available in the morning, a glass of wine from 4-6 in the evening (and before and after it's just $6 a glass - a bargain in San Francisco!) and a small restaurant with great food. Our room was at the back of the hotel and was large, quiet and had two comfy double beds, a desk, a large tv, chairs, a stocked mini fridge (with room for us to slip in a bottle of wine), robes and slippers. All of the staff were wonderful and made us feel totally welcome (even though we arrived hours too early on our first day). They told us to go out and enjoy our day and our luggage would be in our room when we returned - and it was. They were happy to book us an airport shuttle and keep our luggage while we enjoyed our last day in San Francisco. They gave us suggestions for places to eat and to visit and gave us maps with our route marked out. This really is a lovely place to stay and I will return!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable ,friendly hotel iin excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rvwillie
Reviews.Content: Lovely comfortable hotel with personal friendly welcome. Ideal location with few minutes walk to downtown. Only downside is they don't serve breakfast but there are plenty of nice places that do on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy bed and cute pug!”
Reviews.Author: PCHTraveller
Reviews.Content: My partner and I landed in San Fran and went straight to the Rex where we'd booked 4 nights accommodation at the start of our holiday travellling the PCH. Hotel was perfectly situated on the edge of Union Square and just a stone's throw away from the breakfast paradise of Sears (best pancakes in California!). The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel mascot (a pug dog) was as cute and friendly as could be. The hotel was clean, beds extremely comfy and the bar drinks a very reasonable price. They even have local mucians playing in the evenings which is a lovely touch. Downsides - the bedroom lacked natural daylight. However, as we were out and about most of the day it didn't really bother us. We got a great deal for a multiple night stay and the location really couldn't have been more convenient. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located with incredible helpful staff (a bit noisy)”
Reviews.Author: BrownieBern
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located. It is clean and comfortable. Perhaps the only thing to criticise is the bad isolation against the noise: We could hear the traffic and the voices from our 4th floor room. Most of all we will remember Hotel Rex for how Brian Hansen, the Director of Operations, helped us. By checking-out, our rented car came almost an hour after we asked for it (they have vale-parking). Someone made a mistake with our room number. It does not matter: such things can happen. Nevertheless, the situation was a little stressing (we had a long trip ahead of us) and when our car finally arrived, I packed quickly our luggage in the trunk and closed it realising at that very moment that I left the keys in my jacket... in the trunk. My fault. Then I went back into the hotel again asking for help and Bradley Hansen spent all the time necessary helping us until somebody came to open our car. Bradley was extremely helpful, patient on the phone asking, doing what was necessary, inviting us for a drink while we waited ... We did appreciate his readiness, efficiency and understanding of the situation. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean hotel with charm and character”
Reviews.Author: BunnyMpls33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Rex last week for a few nights of business travel and absolutely adored it. I love older, boutique hotels with character and charm that don't lose site of cleanliness, great service and amenities, and this one had it all. I'm a tough critic, too, because I'm a hotelier myself. The staff was welcoming and helpful. This hotel has such an intimate, cozy feel. It's not intimidating and feels like it's a private little getaway spot. Happy hour in the evening with complimentary wine is a nice amenity. The beds were so comfortable, and there was little noise to be heard if any at all. Desk was great for work I had to do and the rooms were spacious! My only complaint was lack of light in the bathroom, but that's the least of my concerns for a hotel stay. I was so pleased with my stay and would definitely stay there again - great location, too!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Rex”
Reviews.Author: LuvSDenvirons
Reviews.Content: I had a business meeting on Market Street (financial area of SF) and decided upon this hotel. I walked nearly a mile to my meeting from the hotel but it saved me from taking a taxi plus I got some exercise! You could walk right by this hotel without even knowing about its existence. It is very small hotel but what a delightful stay I had. The staff (especially Jeff) was so friendly and I loved seeing Max the dog in the lobby. The building is probably from the 1920's or 30's but the decor is wonderful. They have coffee and newspapers in the a.m. I only stayed 1 night wish it was longer. The room (king bed) was small but spacious and beautifully decorated. There was even a robe and slippers waiting for my tired soles! The only major complaint is the parking (about $40) but this is the same w/all SF hotels (the city just wasn't built for all the traffic and you have to valet park your car). Although I did not take the trolley, I believe the hotel is centrally located to trolley stops. There is plenty to do in the area. Make sure you pack a good pair of walking shoes! The hotel restaurant looked good but I did not try it. If you go to SF make sure you visit Mitchell's (I believe this is the correct spelling) for handmade ice-cream...simply the best!!!! It's not close to the hotel but an established SF icon. I would definitely return to Hotel Rex.

Reviews.Title: “Solid option for visiting San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: markstravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rex for the first 4 nights of our west coast honeymoon. Positives - great location by union square, clean rooms with comfotable bed and tidy decor, free wine between 5-6 pm each evening, friendly and very helpful staff at reception. Negatives - no real recognition of our honeymoon, even though they knewvof this from our booking, small rooms, poor view and possibly a little dark. Overall though, very happy with our stay and a great base to explore the wonderful city of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great bite of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: legolizzie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the beginning of our trip to San Francisco and we couldn't have asked for a better place to start our experience in California. The staff was superb, especially Zac, who welcomed us at check in. We asked quite a lot of questions and everyone at the desk was knowledgable and very helpful. The room was modernly funky but still felt homey, even though it was on the small side. However, most rooms in San Francisco are on the small side if you stay under $200 a night, I think. The location was also perfect for sightseeing. Two blocks south of the Chinatown entrance and the Powell cable cars ran up the street perpendicular to the hotel so we could hear the 'ding ding' of the bell from our room (fantastic!!). Great toiletries, too, and a comfy bed (we had a queen standard room). We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Superb Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Alanis82
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in Hotel Rex for 2 nights in June. The location of this hotel is great. You can actually walk from there everywhere with taking a cab or bus. First of all the staff of the hotel is excellent, I mean all of them-people working there are so nice and friendly , also very helpfull- I think they are the best hotel staff, of all hotel's I've ever been to. A free glass of wine was a very nice welcome gesture, plus the wine was very good-not some cheap house wine. We had a room on 7th floor, but with no view. The room was not to big, but the bed was very confortable and the room was clean. The bathroom was ok, clean. You can order some food to your room for a small charge from downstaris cafe. I would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Warm & Cozy, In An Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Bette P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is decorated in warm, rich colors and instantly makes you feel at home. The rooms are large by European standards and small by American Standards. I had a Queen room, which was perfect for one person - it might be too tight for two people, though. The room comes equipped with a mini-fridge, which is handy for snacks & beverages, excellent toiletries and (my favorite) a bathrobe. The location on Sutter, between Powell & Mason, is ideal for cable cars, BART, and buses that will take you anywhere you want to go in the city. It is also two blocks from Union Square. I enjoyed breakfast & dinner at the adjacent restaurant, Café Andrée, and the meals were good and comparably priced to other restaurants in the area. I was fortunate to run into Max, the Pug - the hotel mascot. He is adorable & sweet!! I highly recommend this hotel for any traveler who wants a warm and cozy hotel located in the middle of Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, comfy beds and excellent staff to make you feel at home”
Reviews.Author: karaselby
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Rex for 3 wonderful nights. The staff was so helpful with any questions we had and made my family feel right at home. We traveled with our children (ages 5 and 7) and they were excited every day to see the hotel dog Maximo. After a long day of sightseeing it was a delight to have the free glass of wine offered to us when getting back to the hotel and the children recieved a child friendly beverage as well. The location of the hotel is amazing and we cannot wait to go back to this wonderful city/hotel. A special shout out to Bradley who helped plan our stay. Thank you so much for everything.

Reviews.Title: “A elegant boutique hotel with an eclectic edge in the middle of everything!”
Reviews.Author: Terrijude
Reviews.Content: I came to San Francisco with a group of friends to celebrate a couple of birthdays. We had limited funds and as a co-founder of a lifestyle website (affordablecool.com) wanted a great deal. We booked at Hotel Rex on the recommendation of our travel expert and loved it! Boutique hotels are the way to go because they have a lot of charm for less money and located in the heart of everything. They have complimentary wine every night at 5pm and on Friday's featuring the Golden Gate Philharnonic which is a San Fracisco youth orchestra. The rooms are colorful, comfortable and cozy and the service is first rate!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tarras10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, close to Union Square. It's comfortable and clean, and our room was a good size. It's a character hotel, so don't expect it to be too streamlined. When we hit technical difficulties receiving an international phone call, the staff were great and went out of their way to fix the problem as soon as possible. We found this an ideal hotel for our holiday, close to everything we wanted, good cafes and restaurants nearby, and a comfy bed at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “The Family Loved Everything! THANK YOU HOTEL REX!”
Reviews.Author: Boca2007
Reviews.Content: First of all, thank you to all you trip advisor reviewers who have helped me over the years find such awesome lodging. Trip Advisor is the reason I found Hotel Rex and I couldn't be more appreciative. This was the perfect place for our family of 5. We had 2 King Suites right next to each other. Room 402 had lovely views of the garden below. So unexpected for downtown SF! My kids loved chubby pug Max who hangs out in the lobby. Every so often, he moves! The location is absolutely perfect. Our rooms were spacious, clean, and well appointed. We loved the big flat screen tvs and the pull-out couches came in handy for our teenagers. The little restaurant next door was convenient for breakfast. Jeff at the reception desk was always available to help in any way he could. I adored the complementary coffee and tea in the mornings, and even better, the free glass of wine from 5-6. This hotel was a great value and we have great memories of our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a lot within walking distance of this hotel and close to cable car route”
Reviews.Author: nougats
Reviews.Content: Our room for two adults and two teenagers was a bit cramped and I made the mistake of going for a double and a sofa bed instead two doubles as it was supposed to give us more room. My back still hasn't recovered! The staff were friendly but I felt the whole decor was a bit gloomy not light and airy.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: SneakerladyNY
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 lovely days in SF and at the Rex. Felt right at home when we walked into the lobby. The room was clean and had everything we needed. The 5-6pm wine in the bar/library was especially pleasant as we took a break from daytime activities before the evening. One night Miner Family Vineyards offered a tasting--try their Cabernet...it was great! The Rex is at a great location for cable car with access to Fisherman's Wharf and just about anything you could want it outside your door within a couple of blocks. Great location if you like to walk. Front desk staff always most helpful and pleasant. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in an ideal central position”
Reviews.Author: hughstjust
Reviews.Content: We found the service most friendly, helpful and approachable at all times. The ambience of the hotel was quiet and restful - most extraordinary as the position in Sutter Street was close to Union Square and therefore very central. The hotel smelt clean and fresh - as compared to some we had experienced. Our room was at the back of the hotel and rather small - although we were happy enough there and the room itself was immaculate. We tended to breakfast at Loris Diner nearby but found the breakfasts at the Rex quite passable. Go there!

Reviews.Title: “A charming & comfortable, yet economical, place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: InfrequentTraveler55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Rex while attending a conference at the Moscone Center. This hotel may be a bit off the radar for other conference attendees and as such, is the perfect compromise of being close to the Moscone, but not overwhelmed by other attendees. The cost was very competitive. The walk to Moscone quite nice. The hotel staff were fantastic. They were able to help with anything I needed and gave particularly good dining recommendations. I would definitely stay at Hotel Rex again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “You should definitely stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Padme_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rex has become my go-to place to to stay in the city with its great rates and central location - everything is within walking distance, or just a short cab ride away. The rooms are comfortable and the staff is really friendly - we asked for a recommendation for crab outside of the Wharf, and the concierge gave us a great suggestion for a place nearby that was perfect for what we wanted. This is definitely the place to stay if you're looking for a relaxed, easy stay in SF. The ammenities are better than average, the rooms and the bathrooms are clean, and the location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great central San Francisco hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarge94061
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as it was on special offer with my travel agent and I'm glad I did. Its in a great location just a block away from Union Square and within easy reach of the SF Muni transport system. The room was really nice, typical of a boutique hotel. My only criticism would be the air con unit which was very noisy (had to be used as SF was very hot during my stay). Coffee was on offer in the lobby in the morning and they also offered a complimentary wine hour in the evening. The staff were great as well, helping with all of my requests. I would defo recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice central hotel in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel where you are made to feel welcome and at ease”
Reviews.Author: TXVet82
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rex is very convenient to hop on the cable car and head for Union Square in one direction or Chinatown/Fisherman's Wharf in the other. The front desk staff is awesome, very helpful, and Max the Pug, official mascot dog, is wonderful to pet when your own dogs are at home. I love the lobby with its comfy chairs, books, and newspapers -- feels very peaceful to drink your(complementary) coffee in the morning, plus nice free glass of wine each evening(and a string quartet one evening.)

Reviews.Title: “Unique lodging in a great location !”
Reviews.Author: vjc2820
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay in this charming Union Square hotel. The service was outstanding and the queen room was attractive, clean and large enough for our needs with a good sized bathroom. We definitely would stay there again , especially since it's a block from Union Square and a half block from a Cable Car line.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: encyclopediabrown
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Rex for 3 nights with my daughter. Front desk staff offered us a room with 2 beds instead of the queen I had booked which was very astute of them. Complimentary morning coffee, evening wine, computer use, wi-fi, and a large comfortable lobby for reading were all benefits. One block to Powell cable cars and a short walk to all the shopping anyone could want. Room was large and comfortable. Quieter than most city hotels. Overall I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a hotel with a lot of character”
Reviews.Author: warringtonmcfc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in San Francisco for three nights at the Rex. The location makes it a perfect base for exploring. The hotel has plenty of character and the staff were extremely friendly throughout. I can highly recommend the breakfast at Cafe Andree (Eggs Bennedict in particular). The bar was very nice also (make sure you go for the free glass of wine 5pm till 6pm). Rooms large with high ceilling and very quiet. Wifi available in room with good signal. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “super location,wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: backincarmel
Reviews.Content: This review is written by "BackinCarmel's girlfriend..FYI My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night, upon check in we were told that we were about to experience the Friday night entertainment in the bar. So we went in and were surprised by some inner city children palying the most beautiful classical music.We enjoyed our complimentary glasses of wine and sat in the cozy bar. After the front desk staff made recommendations for dinner. the location was so perfect we were able to walk to dinner, in fact when we got back from dinner we decided to stay an extra night!! Our room was clean, cozy, and decorated whimsical (which we liked). We loved the place encluding the Hotel mascot ...the cutest pug ever! The Location and staff make this Hotel the best place to stay in SF union square area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Near Union Square in a quaint boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dt0wn_traveler
Reviews.Content: Had stayed in numerous other properties, so was a little reluctant to try a new one. Hotel is quaint, tastefully appointed, relatively quiet (for SanFran) and staff was superb. Wine tasting in the evenings was pleasant and relaxing. Rooms are a little smaller than some chains in suburbs, but relatively large for downtown San Francisco. My room was near the back so relatively quiet. Classy place for a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: BBPlump
Reviews.Content: Very nice boutique hotel in the heart of the Union Square area. Nice room, amazing shower, nice lobby, exceptionally helpful staff. Would stay here again anytime. Request a room on a high floor in the back.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: wkndwarrior09
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night, before heading to wine country for our honeymoon. The hotel was perfect for what we needed. Good value, good location, and friendly staff. The rooms are small, but comfortable. We enjoyed a glass of wine downstairs for happy hour. The one drawback was the view. Our room had a view of the parking lot and wall of the building next door. Other than that it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classy stay at the Hotel Rex!”
Reviews.Author: cgtb1305
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Rex during the first part of our honeymoon trip through North America. We tend to favour smaller boutique hotels with character and this certainly did not disappoint. When we were greeted on arrival, we were congratulated on our recent marriage and upgraded to an Executive King Room which was very spacious - there was also a card and some chocolates waiting for us in the room which was a lovely surprise. The service was impeccable throughout and nothing was too much trouble. The staff were very informative and also very proud of their City! We had breakfast once in Cafe Andree which was very nice although we ventured out during other days to enjoy what San Francisco had to offer! The free coffee in the morning and wine hour late afternoon is also a lovely touch and we really enjoyed this. The location is fantastic being just a couple of blocks from Union Square and the cable cars making it easy to get around. The only slight issue we had - and it was slight - is that occasionally the mini bar fridge can be a bit noisy during the night but this is nothing major. Overall, a great stay and start to our honeymoon and we will check out Joie de Vivre hotels if we are back in San Francisco again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in a Union Square”
Reviews.Author: ChefDo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the city for a quick get-away weekend. We loved the location of this hotel. Only 2 blocks from Union Square!!! Our room was very clean & comfortable. We had a great breakfast the next morning at the Cafe Andre.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, chic hotel, but room not so great”
Reviews.Author: adrianacollado
Reviews.Content: Very nice little boutique hotel at a great location just a block or so from Union Square. I really liked the decor and atmosphere, but our room could have been better. It was certainly clean and nice, but the floor was slanted (yes, slanted) and during the night, I kept sliding into my husband while we were sleeping. Also, our TV reception was TERRIBLE. We couldn't see certain channels b/c it was so bad. Lastly, the towels in the bath were really rough and scratchy. I'm betting the "slanted room problem" could easily have been resolved by our requesting to move to another room, but we got too wrapped up in having fun in San Fran. I liked the hotel more than my husband did. I think that it depends on what room you get.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: elhawk2000
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews, we expected a lot more. But here's what we found: an old remodeled hotel with small rooms, where the king size bed takes up the whole room. The in-room A/C was a window-mounted unit that was so noisy that it kept us awake at night, but it had to be kept on or the room got too hot and stuffy. There was no in-room coffee. There was coffee service in the lobby, but they removed it at 10:00 am, so ... if you awoke late, you had to hoof it to Starbuck a block and a half away. The showers are real low-flow and the beds were extra firm. On the plus side, the staff was very helpful, and the hand-painted lamp shades and cool art work on the walls were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and relaxing... Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: pgal81
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rex is a very chic hotel. It was a very relaxing experience as our room was very cozy and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and the bar area with live jazz music was great. Overall it was a great experience and would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel near Union Square!”
Reviews.Author: PepperPinewood
Reviews.Content: With all the Hotels in the city, you can pretty much throw a rock and hit three ,and all too often spend a fortune, or miss...... but my Fiance and I wanted something quaint, friendly, fun, price friendly, and most of all clean. We LOVED Hotel Rex. Conveniently located just off Union Square, close by parking garages, friendly staff, great restaurant, pet friendly, beautifully updated decor and soooo comfortable. We checked in late Sunday night, offered complimentary Glass of wine at the Bar, and enjoyed the company in the lounge. We took a walk just up the block and had some great pizza, strolled around in the rain, and loved their pillow top mattress when we returned. We felt like we were at home... Plasma TV's, wireless internet, and more!!! We will be looking for Joie de Vivre Hotels where ever we go...

Reviews.Title: “Very Cute Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NavarroI
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, upgraded rooms, nice hotel bar!!!!! Location is great!

Reviews.Title: “Personal Touch”
Reviews.Author: marathonman513
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Rex during my last business trip to San Francisco and was amazed at the personal attention I received. In fact, the Director of Operations sat down with my wife and me when we arrived late on a Saturday night and told us all about the hotel, great places to eat and visit and even some about his personal life. The next day we had several questions about logistics and where to find things and the guest staff were very friendly about answering questions and making us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, close to the action.”
Reviews.Author: BruceMN
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on several reviews in tripadvisor and other guide books. We found the advice right on target. The hotel was a great value and located very close to many attractions and shopping. We will look forward to staying here again some day.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite SF hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunnyporch
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in many SF hotels, particularly around Union Square, always on the lookout for our 'default' hotel. We found it in the Rex. Perfect location just up from the Square, wonderful decor, a cozy library/lobby featuring a full bar with lively happy hour, and an exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. Didn't have dinner or room service at the attached Cafe Andree but breakfast was great. Our room was spacious for a boutique hotel in an older building, though with no view and just one window (which we decided to enjoy as cozy.) It looked like rooms closer to the street were double windowed and sunnier. Overall, a terrific experience.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful hotel with staff that bend over backwards to help”
Reviews.Author: wilbach
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay to visit San Francisco - very good food, wonderful relaxing ambiance. Staff are some of the best I have experienced in all the hotels I have staye across the World. I would not hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Only hotel I'll stay at when in SF”
Reviews.Author: GueraKeyWest_FL
Reviews.Content: We felt like we had stumbled across an unknown gem when we discovered everything this hotel has to offer. Great location, great staff, good food, free glass of wine every night, free entertainment...Can't think what I would improve in this hotel. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: MartyBeingMarty
Reviews.Content: All the reviews are spot-on. This hotel has friendly service, a funky decor, great location and at VERY reasonable prices. My room was a teeny bit tired (it's not a new hotel), but for the price it was well worth it. I would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: AishaCelia
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at Hotel Rex. The staff was friendly, professional and helpful. My room was well lit, clean and beautifully decorated. There was a nice large flat screen tv, comfortable large bed, wifi Plus the valet service was a deal. I will refer friends and family. I hope to stay at the Rex again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and friendly”
Reviews.Author: davidh of england
Reviews.Content: A small friendly hotel - with great staff - and a free glass of wine in the early evenings, often accompanied by live music - with the ambience of a cultured small private club rather than the soulless anticharm of a chain hotel. The first room we were offered was rather gloomy, but thge second - no quibbling - was just great. To be recommended - we would go again

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to make home in the city.”
Reviews.Author: Otbc2002
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rex is the best of many worlds with it's dog friendly central location, along with well appointed rooms and hotel amenities, this truly is a place I will return to. With the complimentary glass of wine in the bar in the early evening and the restaurant on site, this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: philly18
Reviews.Content: From checking in to checking out, the front desk check-in person was extremely helpful, friendly, and warming. He upgraded our room to a deluxe king for no additional charges. He also extended our check-out time by 1hour since we were running a little late. The room was clean and very comfortable. We would definitely return if we ever needed a place to stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolinSt
Reviews.Content: The rooms were reasonably sized and the staff in the reception was friendly. All enquiries were solved fast and professional. The hotel is located close to the Union Square so everything is easy to reach.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks, for the memories....”
Reviews.Author: Coconut1961
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 wonderful days in San Francisco and at the Rex Hotel. The location was in a safe area, and very convenient, which made it easy to get around using public transportation.
